Most likely the best motorbike Milestone has put out so far. MXGP 2020 might take the crown soon. GET IN ON SALE ONLY. Here goes some MASS of opinions. Pros: ++ First person view experience is great. + Lots of customization and official gear. + Free Roam map. + Nicely crafted courses. + Official content from AMA SX Series. + Fun to ride and push hard + AI is better than previous ++ Graphics are pretty neat Cons: -Milestone usual quirks as it feels like they take the worse from AAA titles.: --- No option to launch from stationary during qualifying. Being forced to watch the auto pilot until the player has control. -- Lack of camera adjustments on options. ---- Missing set default camera in options menu for those who enjoy more first person view or one of the other 3 camera options other than the default 3rd person. -- Loads of cutscenes at the beginning of each racing session (Heat 1/2, LCQ, Main Events). Making lots of 'press A to continue' on the screen after you opted to 'race'. Time wasting. ---- Lack of full customization of Environmental Sounds. You'll be hearing the same voice overs through out the races from some live commentator in the stadiums and won't be able to disable these sounds because the minimum is 50% on the menu. Same goes for crowd over cheering. Something CM F1 games finally are making it right. It was much worse in the first MESX1. ------- AI is horrid on race starts making your gate position meaningless. If you are barely decent, you can make 100% whole shots against the max AI. ---- Some Circuits the AI is still too easy. ---Casing jumps still is too forgiving. - A 2-stroke DLC bike and rider from the 90s that I don't even own keep appearing on championships. Major Request at the WHOLE of Milestone games: MAKE MAX AI IMPOSSIBLE TO BEAT, so players will always have something good to race against despite their skill level. I cannot fathom a good value on a racing game where youtubers are letting the AI head start by 20 seconds on MAX difficulty. I'm letting a recommended for the improvements they've made and it is fun stuff, but it is cutting close to a not recommended.

值得一入，妹控的更值得一入 这游戏…怎么说，一开始玩的时候觉得蛮有趣，“我”写的东西也挺有意思，教授讲的话也有趣且值得思考，尤其那一句“你这样让我显得很没有教养，因为有教养的人根本不屑和你说话”这话超有意思，简直get到一个嘲讽人的点。但是越玩下去越觉得有点心疼，玩到“我”跟小茸“表白”，小茸哭了那一段，当“这应该是只有她能理解的悲伤，连我都理解不了的悲伤”这段文字浮现，我默默停下了Ⓐ，这游戏似乎并不像我们所想象的那样，带着一点深度、带着一点悲伤。 主人公和小茸其实是教授的实验品，用来证明谈恋爱很蠢，需要一个筛选机制，让人一见钟情，然后相守一生。 这个想法让人觉得既糟心又美好。但是结合开发者单身的现实状况来看，这设定显得有趣了起来… 哈哈哈。

Wonderful game for Poirot fans, and also those new to Agatha Christie.  It holds all the charm, mystery and clever intent of a good Christie novel (nothing lost in translation here) and the characters are three dimensional enough to be engaging, without being over the top. The game is very reminiscent of the David Suchet Poirot films, so has an atmosphere of elegance and style of 1930s England, marred only by the occasional murder!  The music, background sounds, and voice acting are superb, no clumsy accents in this game! The game play, combining traditional point and click, observations, puzzles and 'grey cells' thinking give something for everyone, and means the game play doesn't become boring. The story is thrilling, and you truly feel like you are the one solving these murders! Overall I am more impressed with this game than I expected to be.  (I was prepared to hate the portrayal of Poirot as only Suchet has ever played him to perfection in my eyes.)  I feel incredibly satisfied having finished, and will look forward to playing it again later to get some remaining achievements.

I have played Dark Souls 3 enough to say that this is a great game. Regardless what you think of its difficulty - there is nothing like the feeling of overcoming a boss in Dark Souls after a lot of tries, and mastering fighting any enemy in the game. If you don't have the patience to learn patterns and be strategic with your movement and attacks, than Devil May Cry might be better suited for you. If you feel the cozy feeling of mastering something, such as pottery - and then creating something magnificent that you can be proud of, in this case your character/s - then Dark Souls 3 is for you. A great community, both on Reddit and around here on Steam - PvP is fun as hell and I would reply Dark Souls over and over again without ever getting bored of any of the things that it offers.

Es uno de los mejor shooter competitivo que puedes encontrar en el mercado. Quizá 'Counter-Strike: Global Offensive' no sea el juego más comercial del mundo, ni la saga esté en su mejor momento (a pesar de haber ganado, de nuevo, enorme popularidad en los últimos años), incluso que sus mecánicas, en cierta forma, necesiten una pequeña revisión. Sí, es posible, pero incluso con eso este juego es de largo el mejor shooter que vas a poder encontrar en el mercado. Ojo, su fórmula va a requerir un pequeño aprendizaje por parte del jugador, algo que prácticamente la totalidad de títulos de hoy en día deciden eliminar por un terror desmesurado a perder a algún jugador por el camino: los jugadores novatos al principio van a sufrir, y mucho, pero por contrapartida, cuando ya has aprendido lo suficiente en cuanto a sus mecánicas se refiere o bien concluímos una buena ronda, consigue generar una fuerte sensación de recompensa, nada comparable a lo que sus competidores podrían ofrecerte. Y es que Counter-Strike, sin llegar a estar cercano a ser un simulador, no va a perdonar un error, ni va a suprimir el retroceso de las armas, ni va a permitir impactar en el enemigo si vamos corriendo o saltando: es un shooter táctico y que se toma a sí mismo en serio, no como una broma de mal gusto. A veces está bien que no se trate al jugador como a un idiota (ojalá fuese la norma). No me gustaría acabar el análisis sin hacer mención a un grave problema, y es que hay bastantes incidencias en lo que se refiere a trampas: Cuando Valve hace una oleada de baneos se agradece, pero aún así ni la oleada es 100% efectiva (puesto que incluso profesionales que han admitido usarlas han estado años y años compitiendo sin problemas) ni los tramposos tardan en volver (en rebajas el juego sale muy bien de precio, y si les banean una cuenta tienen otra o no tardan en tenerla). Aún así quiero aclarar que no hay tantos tramposos como se dice, la comunidad es muy de acusar a la primera de cambio, pero que hay es evidente y de vez en cuando te cruzas con alguno que ni disimula. En conclusión, es un juego que definitivamente merece la pena, con una absurda relación calidad / precio, al que tratan con mimo y van actualizando (aunque deberían hacer mucho más hincapié en el sistema anti-trampas) pero al que deberás dedicar tiempo y paciencia para mejorar. No te dejes engañar el CS:1.6 nunca muere.

Quantum Break is a sc-fi thriller which delves into time travel and its effect on its world and characters, if you've ever played a remedy game you will feel right at home, the story is told via 20 mins tv like episodes and with the characters looking exactly like their in-game like apart from the likeness and voice the clothes and other small details are exactly same as their in-game counterparts the transition feels seamless, one issue i have with those webisodes is that they are easy skip by mistake and there is no way to rewatch because its streamed off your internet and does not come with the game files so thats a letdown because i once skipped an episode when i wanted to pause it but since its too easy to skip coz the video ui is terrilbe and with no way to rewatch it i had to go to youtube to watch the entire episode.The characters are very likeable and even the enemies are presented as humans with very different goals and agendas instead of flat out cardboard cut out generic enemy, this is done by them letting you play as the villian for the choice segment which is somewhat impact on the story but make them feel much more human as you get to know why they are doing the things they are doing.Visually the game looks very good and the time stutters makes the levels look chaotic and beautiful, the game without a doubt has the best global illumination ive ever seen in a game till date.Only complaint i have visually is you cant get rid of the motion blur on anything which annoyed the hell out of me. Gameplay-wise Quantum Break is amazing the time powers are really fun to use and very handy at the same time, its very well balanced because some enemies with special suits are able to counteract your powers and this creates a very satisfying gameplay for example in one level i entered a area filled with ten or so normal enemies but then the time stutter happened and four special enemies came who are not affected by it nor my powers and after getting past them the stutter ended and i had to deal with the normal ones but my powers being useful invoked a sense of power that very few provide as the special enemies are tough to beat but the normal ones are not too easy to coz the gang up on you and after using a power it has a cooldown timer so you cant spam the same powers over and over which forces you to carefully use your powers.The gunplay is very tight and the guns feels pretty good with a good variety of different guns or different varients of the same gun. The only minor complaints i have is that the final boss was really hard on the hardest difficulty and i had to switch to easy to complete the game was it was genuinely frustrating and not enjoyable.The only other complaint apart from that is technical problem which is the game you might have to lock it to 30 fps or lower the settings quite a bit to hit that constant 50-60 fps, i would say it needed more optimization but that would be somewhat wrong because this problems stems from how good the lighting and the global illumination effects look also i remember remedy saying the console counterpart runs in on medium-high compared to the PC version because the game is just heavy, it could've been optimized a bit maybe but not a lot i feel however if you have a recent PC which is really high end you should not experience these problems. Overall if you've played games like max payne and alan wake you loved it like me you should definitely pick this game up.

えっ、これDLCでよくね？(´・ω・`) と言いたくなる程、前作と全く代わり映えしないpart2です。 基本的なアクション部分は一切変わらず、前作の続きからストーリーが展開していき 一応シリーズ的には終わりを迎えますが、ボリュームは若干少なくなっています。 目新しい要素と言えば、ボンテージに身を包んだお姉さんと、ボンテージに身を包まれたデブが 雑魚として追加されたくらいです。 主人公の2人も相変わらず惚れ惚れする程無骨に制裁を下していきますが、 特に↑のお姉さんに対するコンボ攻撃のフィニッシュがまあエグイ。 ロールシャッハは顔面ばかり殴るし、ナイトオウル君も野郎より控えめな攻撃で ちょっとは紳士的に思えましたが、たまにすまし顔でバックスピンキックを顔面に撃ち込んだりします。 ほんまにヒーローなんか(´・ω・`) おすすめポイントは前作のレビューと全く同じですが、↑な要素があるので ちょっと人を選ぶかもしれません。 （個人的にはメタスコア以上に楽しめましたが） ストーリー的には続き物ですので、前作と合わせてのご購入をおすすめします。

Хороший представитель 3D-платформеров новой волны, перенимающий опыт современных игр жанра, принимающий их нововведения, который не пытается ориентироваться только на старую аудиторию, делая игру как по шаблону из "тех самых времен", скрывая лень и недоработки словом "ретро". Многие в обзорах сравнивают Super Lucky's Tale с Crash Bandicoot, но я вообще не вижу никаких сходств, кроме каких-то общих черт как для жанра, механики тут куда более плавные и медитативные, скорее напоминающие Spyro, геймплей также отличается, здесь, за некоторыми исключениями, каждый уровень это не коридор, по которому ты движешься к одной цели, в Super Lucky's Tale почти всегда есть несколько целей и пускай это те же задания на собирательство, происходят они в различных развилках и дополняются мини-заданиями, что в корне меняет ощущение дизайна уровней и побуждает к исследованию мира.  Игра обладает просто фантастически милым визуальным рядом с множеством мелких деталей, мир не ощущается пустым. Графика отличная, особенно при своей оптимизации, персонажи анимированы очень хорошо, действия игрока сопровождаются ответной реакцией, как то соприкосновение с листьями заставляет их двигаться, атака обычных неигровых персонажей сопровождается анимацией и звуком, причем для некоторых они индивидуальны даже среди одного типа персонажа. Геймплей очень гладкий, действия переходят от одного к другому максимально мягко. Музыку для игры писала целая студия с большим опытом, которая до этого занималась крупными проектами, такими как Uncharted, Prey, Halo и другими. Все выполнено на профессиональном уровне, будто могло быть иначе? Но к сожалению, саундтреку не хватает "души", он отлично выполняет роль фоновой музыки, дополняет атмосферу, но к нему не хочется возвращаться после завершения игры.  . У игры есть некоторые проблемы с регистрацией попаданий и иногда это малость выбешивает, но в целом, мне даже не к чему придраться, ведь игра дарит неподдельные эмоции и детский восторг, 7 часов игры прошли практически незаметно, на одном дыхании и даже не хотелось спать, чтобы завершить игру до конца. Возможно весь мой обзор выглядит несколько приторно, но я правда считаю Super Lucky's Tale недооцененным бриллиантом, зря обруганным "критиками" в свое время.

Nous jouons une petite fille inuit nommée Nuna, intrépide et curieuse, qui tente d'enquêter sur les blizzards incessants qui empêche son peuple de chasser, et le conduit à la famine. Très vite nous croiserons son petit compagnon, un renard arctique qui communique avec les esprits. Dans ce jeu de plateforme atmosphérique, on peut collectionner des hiboux au cours de la partie qui débloquent de courts documentaires sur les coutumes inuit, la relation particulière qu'entretiennent les natifs d'Alaska avec la faune et la sagesse, la valeur de leur culture. Une combinaison intéressante de documentaire et de jeu vidéo qui nous emmène vers une civilisation qui fait face à des difficultés de la nature depuis des siècles. C'est un jeu beau, très poétique, touchant qui propose une expérience instructive intéressante. Ce jeu nous dévoile une culture fascinante qu'on ne connait pas forcément. Durée de vie de 3h/4h (8 chapitres fanstastiques). Un dlc "Never Alone: Foxtales"  prolongera l'aventure de Nuna et de son ami polaire (de 1h30).

(NEW REVIEW) One of my favorite games among any other in my library, it is really addictive! Killing Floor 2 is a sequel to its successful predecessor and many improvements from the first game is brought into here. Pros: - Improved graphics (using heavily modified Unreal Engine 3) - More perks (Survivalist, SWAT, etc) - Much more balanced gameplay (it calculates the players perk, more high level players means much more difficult) - Introducing new PVP mode (Kinda, its still a survival mode with other players becoming the zeds. People dont play this alot anymore) - New mechanics (Like sprinting, blood actually stays there for the rest of the game) - New Zeds and Boss (Slasher, Dr Hans Volter, Cyst) - Great soundtrack (Zynthetic is back with more metal bands like Demon Hunters, Living Sacrifices, etc) - Improved gore system (similar to Chilvary, Zeds will sliced/dismembered depending on where you cut/shoot them)  *with additional NVIDIA Flex* - More weapons for each perk Cons: - Some dead servers (especially VS mode) - Cosmetic microtransactions I think that's all folks, you should not miss this game and I'll give this game a 9/10. I would recommend you to buy this game on sale. See you in the game!

To gostando bastante do jogo. Apesar de estar Alpha e ter alguns bugs, vale a pena. Achei um pouco dificil, comparado com Infestation, por exemplo. Se você achar uma lata de comida, precisa ter algum objeto afiado para abrir, caso contrário, ficará com fome. Quedas de certas alturas causam fratura. É bem real. Tomara que coloquem logo os carros e os animais. E sim vale muito a pena comprar o jogo para poder jogar com seus amigos/inimigos. Gosto muito de jogos de sobrevivencia joguei varios tipo de mod DayZ por exemplo : MTA:DayZ , Arma 2 DayZ Mod , Samp DayZ. E sempre gostei muito do modo de jogo que o DayZ traz para os jogadores. Minha nova é 11/10 pra esse jogo maravilhoso. Vale a pena comprar ? Sim vale muito a pena comprar o jogo apesar de ser muito caro você não vai se arrepender de ter comprado. Comprem e divirtam-se !!! Atualização da analise! Nas primeiras horas, pôde parecer meio estranho. Pensei: não to achando comida, nem água, TOMAR NO ##, mas logo em seguida me permiti dar uma chance pro jogo, pois eu tinha apenas umas 20 horas de jogo, tinha morrido por falta de comida 2 vezes. E ai, comecei a aprender sobre o jogo, ver os locais que tinha loot bom, e comecei a conseguir e não precisar me preocupar tanto em só obter alimento, mas sim, armas, camuflagens e etc. RESUMINDO: Se permita aprender, não é simples nas primeiras 10 ~ 20 hrs, o começo é complicado. Mas eu afirmo, depois disso, quando começar a ter precaução antes de entrar nas cidades, ir com cautela, e sentir a angustia de poder ter outro player na mesma cidade e etc, ai sim, você vai lembrar dessa análise e pensa: pota que pariu o cara tinha razão. Não seja fraco, PERSISTA E APRENDA!

Resident Evil 7 is a slow-paced, story-driven, survival-horror FPS game released in early 2017. Heralded as a soft-reboot for the franchise, RE7 appears a perfect starting point to jump into the series. I’ve never personally played a game in the Resident Evil franchise before, so RE7 was a pleasant surprise for me. The game is about as elegant and well designed as a horror title can get, with only a few missteps. I’ll say now that if you’re a fan of the genre, Resident Evil 7 is a must play. In Resident Evil 7 you enter the life of Ethan Winters, an undeveloped protagonist outside of the fact that his wife, Mia, has been missing for three years. She disappeared on a mysterious job she was working, but then at the start of RE7 contacts Ethan, telling him to come to Dulvey, Louisiana to find her at the Baker Family Ranch. Suspicious but overjoyed to discover that his wife is alive, Ethan makes for Louisiana and enters the swamplands of the Baker estate. What he finds there beggars belief. One of the most important elements of any horror experience is the presentation. Luckily, Resident Evil 7 delivers beautifully on this front. The art style is uncut realism, featuring extremely lifelike environments, models, and effects. Textures, atmosphere, and post processing are all of A-grade quality for 2017, and hold up perfectly well three years on. The lighting and faces are particularly impressive though. RE7’s lighting is dynamic, moody, and claustrophobically dark, while the realism of the faces can produce grotesque spectacles. The only visual defect can be found in the somewhat janky movement animations. As for the sound, I have no complaints. Audio is consistently good, with terrifying ambiance and a fitting OST. Performance is also damn-near perfection, with hardly any bugs and comprehensive PC optimization. When it comes to presentation, RE7 has no true shortcomings. The level design in RE7 is an aspect that is part presentation, part gameplay. The decrepit Baker Family Ranch is eerie and hideous, contributing to the atmospheric unease. Various environmental details tell the story of what has occurred there, but I’ll leave that for you to discover. From a gameplay perspective, the level design is broadly “linear,” but this is not entirely the case. You can return to almost all of the areas you’ve been to previously, however as you make progress throughout the campaign there is usually only one way of doing things. Due to the linearity and this being a game that thrives on the player’s fear, some moments are distressing when the single path forward is unclear and you become trapped by enemies. Whether this is a failing or an intentional feature of the design, I’ll leave up to you. Looking at what you actually do in the game, it’s a mix of classical survival-horror and FPS mechanics. Your movement speed is painfully slow, so running away from danger is usually a poor option – you’re meant to sneak around or stand your ground. When it comes to standing your ground, there are various weapons and tools you’ll collect throughout the game. The guns vary wildly in effectiveness; for instance, the pistol is basically a water gun, and the shotgun functions like you’re shooting a damn freight train. RE7 also has the same obligatory loot and crafting system of all survival-horror games these days, enabling you to create first aid meds, pistol bullets, etc. The fun side of this crafting system is that resources are actually extremely limited. Every encounter with an enemy will cost you, making the non-boss fights feel like mini wars of attrition. And when it comes to the bosses, each battle is simultaneously frightening and challenging, keeping you engaged in frantic attempts to destroy your adversary as you pour more and more resources into combat. This core gameplay loop is so surprisingly good, but what’s better is that it’s only the second best item on the menu of what RE7 is serving. At Resident Evil 7’s opening, the game is absolutely terrorizing. Like, muscles-tensed-up-and-fight-or-flight-reflexes-engaged-in-real-life kind of terrorizing. This level of intensity fades after about 2 hours, but the sensation of angst and anxiety as you approach every corner never fades entirely during the 8-10 hour campaign. I believe the sickening setting of the Baker estate, the possessed inhabitants themselves, the resiliency of the enemies, the graphics, the audio, and the uncertainty of what the hell is going on in the narrative all have a hand in producing the most palpably “horror-ific” atmosphere of any game I’ve ever played. RE7 has the classical horror theme down to an absolute science. Ending on a bit of an anticlimax, the story itself is a bit of an anticlimax. This isn’t to say the writing is particularly bad, but for a game that spends a decent amount of time emphasizing its story, there really should have been more here. The main narrative beat is about what has possessed the Baker Family that is holding your wife Mia captive, and figuring out why they are functionally immortal. You accomplish this through encounters with each family member individually, as each member of the Baker Family has a stage of the game where they are the primary antagonist. This is an interesting enough mystery to solve, but the reasons behind their possession are never explained too well, and none of the characters in RE7 are compelling or relatable. In essence, the writing is very bare bones. The splendid gameplay and great atmosphere certainly make up for this one deficiency, but it holds Resident Evil 7 back from the dizzying heights it was so close to. Resident Evil 7 is a refreshingly clear cut, good game in a genre full of mediocrity. It executes on its core design principles flawlessly, resulting in an experience that should be regarded as a shining example of how to do horror right. Its level of polish is something I’ve only hinted at so far, but I believe it’s what makes RE7 as outstanding as it is. Other than the underdeveloped story, there is absolutely nothing about the game that I can point to as a big shortcoming. Add in the high points of its frenetic boss battles and the crippling anxiety its scary side produces, and you have an instant classic on your hands. If you have any level of interest in playing Resident Evil 7, do not hesitate. *Note: RE7 has one short free DLC, “Not a Hero,” which I have played. It introduces a few new gameplay mechanics and expands upon the story in the aftermath of the main game. It’s a solid addition if you enjoyed RE7, however it’s less survival-horror and a lot more FPS-horror.

Despite my low hours on steam, I have nearly 400 hours from beforehand. Trove! Fantastic game. You get low level terrible gear, either make it amazing from the start or find even better gear and start with that. There is currently 11 amazing classes to choose from the start. You get mounts, pets, ships, sails for your ships, fishing poles, and so much more to get more mastery. Mastery shows how much stuff you have for your rank. You deconstruct items you get mastery and good loot, you look awesome in the process, and its just all out fun to get amazing items for both cosmetics and gear! All the pay to win items you can buy with real money, you can also get from other players with trading. Fantastic game. Fun to play with other players!!

From a Chess novice who has had only a passing interest in the game: this is outstanding! It makes me want to get better, and gives me the tools to do it.  . You do not have full control of the placement of the camera (you cannot place the camera from the opponents perspective, for example), but you can place the camera at the sides, directly behind, and directly above - There isn't much lost in keeping the perspective 'as is', however. The game looks beautiful and you can see everything you need to know from the standard angle. Bud, if you're that invested in Chess and want to   this shiz, you don't need this game. Chess is for Kings AND Peasants, and if you fall somewhere in between this gives you a hell of a lot to start with. For example: tutorials, from basic moves to standard tactics. An Elo rating, so you know how bad you suck (and whether or not you're getting better), DECENT customization (standard timers, beautiful backgrounds) I've had zero issues navigating or controlling my pieces. I've had no issues, other than getting my ass kicked. Tournament modes are built in, so make some internet friends you hoser.   + a beautiful interface and AMAZING visuals/background music + online and hotseat support, asynchronous multiplayer  + built-in tournament system + generous tutorials, ability to replay your last matches (and save replays you want to revisit later) + "challenge modes" + a range of AI's to practice against (Novice to Grandmaster - I'm not sure how accurate those titles are, but it encourages me to get better so I can beat the next boss, haha) +rankings, so you can know how you're progressing (or, in my case, DEgressing) As always...

I was trying to write a full review of this game since I felt I had to say something about it, but I'm not a writer and I just couldn't form complete paragraphs from all of my thoughts.  So, here's the most important points I wanted to get across: Absolutely gorgeous hand drawn art. Intricate thought-inducing puzzles. I hope the devs will forgive me, but I know there was a story in there that went over my head.  In my defense, the puzzles were so engaging that I managed to miss the ultimate message.  However, since the game is so short, it makes it easy to play through again to see if I can pick up on the story. Despite how short this game is, it very much feels as though this was a project that took an immense amount of time to produce, but was also very much a labor of love at every step. An absolute masterpiece! Highly recommended if you're looking for a puzzle game that thinks outside the box (which is what you have to do in many instances when playing this game).

Sabe aquele doce que você saboreia com grande deleite? Como se fosse o último do mundo? Pois bem, é mais ou menos assim que você se sentirá ao jogar DOOM Eternal, o mais novo rebento da id Software, empresa que é também a responsável pela criação do gênero FPS. Wolfenstein, Quake, Doom: todas são franquias oriundas do estúdio fundado em Fevereiro de 1991 por John Carmack, John Romero, Tom Hall e Adrian Carmack. E em DOOM Eternal, jogo lançado em 20 de Março de 2020, para PC, PlayStation 4 e Xbox One, a empresa conseguiu, por incrível que pareça, se superar em relação a seu trabalho anterior no DOOM de 2016. O Doom lançado em 2016 conseguiu em diversos aspectos revitalizar a renomada série, iniciada em 1993. Ele também fundamentou um novo patamar para jogos de tiro em primeira pessoa, com ação bastante frenética, gráficos de ponta e níveis enormes. Já DOOM Eternal, é um jogo claramente superior a seu antecessor, e não apenas no quesito “gráficos”, mas também em questões de personalização de armamento, níveis muito maiores, maior tempo de duração (analistas chegaram a estimar o dobro de duração em relação a Doom – 2016), etc. Vale também lembrar que o shooter será lançado para Nintendo Switch, e segundo pude averiguar, ainda em 2020. Vamos torcer para ver o quanto antes este verdadeiro petardo no console híbrido da Nintendo. Como em todo bom Doom que se preze, Eternal tem uma história, digamos, um tanto quanto rasa. Digo isto a princípio, digamos. Para tentar “enganar” você: pois conforme você avança na campanha, acaba percebendo que há ali muito material para entreter e informar. Além disso, se você coletar os diversos pergaminhos espalhados pelo mundo do jogo, os quais são então adicionados ao “Códice”, conseguirá obter informações bastante aprofundadas a respeito de tudo o que está acontecendo, bem como a respeito de acontecimentos anteriores, no universo da franquia. Aliás, há em DOOM Eternal uma certa surpresa para os jogadores que acompanham a franquia há anos, algo que por si só pode representar motivo suficiente para que você adquira o jogo. Também existem vários flashbacks bastante interessantes a respeito do Doom Slayer. O “Cara do Doom”, ou “Doomguy”, acaba se lembrando de momentos antiquíssimos de seu passado, de momentos que, de certa forma, ajudaram a moldar a máquina de massacrar demônios em que ele se transformou. Acredite: vale a pena coletar os inúmeros pergaminhos espalhados pelos mapas de DOOM Eternal para conhecer mais a respeito do jogo e também a respeito do universo no qual ele está inserido. Basicamente, no jogo, a Terra foi invadida por demônios. Logo de início, cerca de 60% do planeta foi consumido pelas forças infernais. A maioria da população morreu no primeiro dia da invasão. 3 Sacerdotes Infernais comandam tais forças, e o primeiro deles, o primeiro alvo do protagonista do jogo, chama-se Deag Nilox. Há muito material para lermos. Existem informações aos montes, sobre as forças infernais, sobre o passado do Doom Slayer, sobre o próprio universo em si, e sobre a própria existência como um todo. É extremamente interessante dar uma olhada em tudo isto. DOOM Eternal é um jogo brutal. Frenético. Violento. Visceral. Hardcore. Um dos melhores (senão o melhor) jogos de tiro em primeira pessoa já lançados. A id Software realmente se superou, neste título, e o que temos em mãos é algo que pode muito bem durar entre 20 a 40 horas de gameplay, dependendo do estilo do jogador, do nível de dificuldade escolhido, etc. O título está repleto de novidades, e sua jogabilidade é verdadeiramente desenfreada. Porém, não tenha medo: o jogo te força a matar, matar, e matar. A dilacerar demônios com rapidez e fluidez. A fazê-los sofrer em suas mãos, ao mesmo tempo em que você obtém recursos necessários para continuar progredindo, como por exemplo vida/sangue e munição. Doom Slayer, como nos jogos anteriores da franquia, é um personagem mudo. E isto não é ruim: digamos que ele se expressa através de sua violência, forjada há bastante tempo. Ele se manifesta com grande pompa no campo de batalha, explodindo e dilacerando demônios com as próprias mãos, e com grande ódio. Confesso que em grande parte do tempo me senti quase que um semideus; isto porque o jogo faz com que o Doomguy consiga se manter quase sempre um passo adiante dos demônios que tanto odeia. Uma das mecânicas mais interessantes de DOOM Eternal está relacionada ao fato de que o jogo nos obriga, de certa forma, a sofrermos dano. Claro, dentro de certos limites, para evitar a morte. Sofremos danos e logo utilizamos a motosserra (a qual requer combustível), para partir demônios mais fracos ao meio, para que possamos então obter a valiosa munição para nossas armas (além de sangue). Também devemos utilizar uma mecânica semelhante, em demônios inertes, cambaleantes (próximos de morrer): com o botão “E”, literalmente os destroçamos, e então são liberados cristais azuis que preencherão nossa barra de vida. Долго думала, покупать её или нет. Купила по скидке. Теперь понимаю, что игра полностью стоит своих денег! Она просто шикарна!  Из плюсов:  + Открытый мир; + Много различных побочных квестов; + Атмосфера; + Мини-игры (кому-то может показаться, что они скучны, но, на мой взгляд, они довольно увлекательны); + Прокачка персонажа; + 2D (для кого-то это, может, и минус, но в этой игре 2D действительно в тему).  Из минусов:  - Свобода прокачки способностей персонажа довольно относительна, так как без некоторых из них не пройти в другие локации, требуется определенный уровень прокачки навыков взлома, определенные импланты (наподобие прыжков или маски); приходится весьма тщательно продумывать, какие навыки качать в первую очередь, так как врагов тоже становится всё больше и больше; - Для любителей легких игр также возникнут сложности, ибо порой приходится бегать туда-сюда лишь бы подлечиться (а это тоже не бесплатно без импланта);  - Несмотря на то, что много квестов побочные и не обязательны для прохождения сюжетной линии, но за них дают деньги, которые необходимы для дальнейшего развития по сюжету. В целом: Сюжет интересный, механика игры отличная, затягивает на долгие часы. Думаю, даже второй раз проходить будет весьма интересно. О покупке не жалею нисколько. Если вы любитель 2D игр, берите, не раздумывая!  P.S. Скидка на Dex довольно частое явление. 10/10

Wieder richtig viele Vollidioten hier. Anstatt das game zu bewerten, wird auf die "MOMENTAN" vorhandenen Server Probleme eingegangen. 3/4 der negativen Bewertungen beziehen sich absolut nicht auf das Spiel selbst, sondern alles was vor dem Login passiert. Die meisten Affen werden ihre Review auch nicht anpassen, somit hat das game Grundlos schlechte Bewertungen. Das ist Geschäftsschädigend und schreckt durch dumme unbeholfene Meinungen neue Käufer ab. Es ist wichtig seine Meinung zu sagen, aber bitte nur wenn man auch Plan hat wovon man spricht. Wie will man etwas richtig bewerten, wenn man es selbst nicht richtig gezockt hat. Es ist völlig akzeptabel wenn man auf Bugs eingeht und deswegen hier negativ bewertet, diese Leute sollten sich auch nicht angesprochen fühlen. Der Rest der einfach nur heult, sollte die Backen halten und einfach warten bis es richtig geht, danach kann man immer noch schlechte Bewertungen rein hauen. Die Entwickler raffen doch selbst das die Server nicht laufen, es wird zu 100% besser die kommenden Tage. Steam sollte hier halt echt mal durch kehren und Bewertungen löschen.  Zu meiner Spielerfahrung: Bei mir lief bis ingame alles gut und ohne Bug. Einziger Bug waren sound Fehler welche aber nur kurz auftraten. Alles funktionierte im Online Modus wie es sollte. Mit Act 1 bin ich bisher sehr zufrieden und die Geschichte ist auch super! Ich kann bisher nicht meckern, sollten sich mir nervige Bugs in den Weg stellen, so werde ich die Review hier noch mal anpassen. Ansonsten macht das game wirklich bock und ich wünsche den Entwicklern viel Erfolg und alles Gute

Looter Shooter风格代表作，这一代除了热修复和掉帧之外也没什么太大的缺点，而游戏性整体来说延续了上一代的水平，画面提升了很多个档次，极富有特色的中文配音差点让我没落泪，中配确实太能看出制作组诚意了，所以，无论这个游戏在现阶段有着怎样破坏游戏体验的瑕疵，依然还是没法掩盖其他fpg游戏没有涉及到的优点。 呃..上热评了那就再跟大家分享两句吧，可能我对于无主系列的评价不够客观，因为我是无主系列的铁粉，一代盗版可能有100+h的游戏时间，二代有300h。其实Looter Shooter的游戏有很多，干嘛非要选择无主之地呢？要知道这种类型的游戏通常有两个通病，一是剧情实在是太糟糕，二是重复性太高。无主之地的剧情一直是我很看好的点，毕竟能让tt社做一部『The tales from borderlands』的游戏，剧情一定相当出彩。二是无主之地的装备系统以及可选支线任务，很大程度上降低了任务的重复性，有相当多的任务会让玩家自己选择结局，在这两个方面上做好了，玩家的代入感就会十分的强烈，从而更好的体验体会这个游戏背后的东西，这是一种良性循环。 总而言之，对于LS爱好者来说应该也不存在没有玩过此系列作品的玩家了，对于第一次尝试fpg系列的玩家我真诚地向你们推荐无主之地系列！ Ready to go？

Verdict: Recommended with no issue. If you plan a single playthrough get it with a discount + Steam trading cards (3 drop, 6 to make badge) Steam achievements (45 in total, require at least 3 playthroughs) Great soundtrack Interesting characters with unique quests Karma system  Enjoyable hack and slash A lot of unique logical puzzles Switching between realms felt felt natural really fast A lot of replayability (3 starting characters, 3 situations when you pick A or B soul) 3 endings (good, bad, true) quite a lot of side quests Full playthrough doing all sidequests - around 25-30 hours Nice to look at with a lot of biomes Some of the hard to get items from early game carry for a long time (I appreciate that) - 2 characters are DLC only Some minor bugs (nothing game breaking) Scaling in chapter 5 and 6 are all over the place (literally millions of exp for no reason) Some locations are damn tedious and take a long time to traverse A lot of loot doesn't feel impactful  Unique items don't feel unique at all - it is basically a stat change Devourer is just amazigly done  +/- One of the achievements is bugged according to forums (hard with no deaths but I have not tested that myself) Loot management is not for everyone as you have to switch characters to equip all of them

The storyline is amazing and is written by the choices you take, truly worth the money spent. The storyline is amazing, filled with plot twists and new things is revealed all the time. Not too much to say here. The graphics has a comic feel to it, just like the comic that this game is based on. It doesn't feel weird at all as you might think, it fits right in. The only thing that i feel they could do better, was the effects. As i stated in the start of this review, the story is tailored by the choices you take in the game. However, sometimes the story might evolve in another way than what you chose/thought of it to go. This, together with the fact that sometimes it might be a little tricky to find out what to do, drags down my rating a bit. The animations however, feel just like they should together with the comic style graphics. The soundtrack for the game is amazing, sounds just like it should and doesn't feel repetitive throughout the game. The music combined with the neatly done voice acting and sound effects, makes the game a joy for the ears. The game in general is amazing and definently worth the money. However, as stated in this review i feel there is some things they could've made better. I would recommend this game to everyone who likes a good story.

Being the latest installment of the GTA franchise (as of 2017), GTA V (or 5) is not all that bad. Although I don't play the game that much anymore, when I bought the game on it's PC launch on steam back in 2015, I was pretty hyped and decided to write a review. Looking back now, GTA V had a pretty interesting storyline for it's Singleplayer Campaign. The first of the franchise to have the ability to switch between 3 different characters (in Singleplayer). It's multiplayer however, is a bit of a let down. You can spend either 24 hours grinding for a certain amount of in game money, or buy that amount of money with real money in just a few clicks. For most players, the latter is disappointing. You have people that have played the game for a long time, only to find out that they've been trumped by another player with a quarter of the playtime and experience just because the other player was willing to spend extra money. The online heists were quite a thrill when they came out, but then they started adding all these freemode events and "extra-curricular" CEO type missions. It just put online mode into more of a grind than before.  However, I will give credit to it's Singleplayer design. That's all I really have to say at this point.

Dandara: Trials of Fear Edition é a nova edição melhorada do indie brasileiro com o estilo de metroidvania. desenvolvido por Long Hat House e distribuído pela Raw Fury. Em uma sociedade à beira do colapso, surge uma heroína, desafiando a gravidade sem medo e sem opressão, com o objetivo de encontrar o equilíbrio do mundo. Antes de mais nada, no titulo nós vamos deparar com diversas influências da história brasileira, uma delas é a  própria protagonista, Dandara, antes de dar nome ao game, foi uma das líderes mais conhecidas no período colonial brasileiro, além de ser esposa do Zumbi dos Palmares lutou contra a escravidão em Palmares no século XVII. E com essa e outras referências da nossa cultura, a equipe da Long Hat House conseguiu criar algo bastante cativante.  A narrativa de Dandara: Trials of Fear Edition, em geral é simples, porém, é bastante interessante possuindo uma trama não linear. O jogador será apresentado ao mundo de Sal, onde uma antiga civilização foi arrasada por uma força sombria, e em meio a opressão quando tudo parecia perdido uma nova esperança surge, a Dandara, para consertar o equilíbrio desse mundo. Algo a se destacar no jogo é sua forte inspiração em títulos metroidvanias clássicos. A qual entramos em uma aventura que é necessário a exploração de todos os cenários compostos por labirintos, entrando e saindo em novos salas recheadas de inimigos. Já outro ponto que ganhou destaque, foi as suas mecânicas e jogabilidade, que é bem diferente dos jogos do mesmo gênero. A princípio é recomendado utilizar um controle para jogar, mas, com poucos cliques, Dandara é capaz de saltar em qualquer chão, parede ou teto que contenha uma camada de sal, para atravessar em todas as áreas, deixando de ser um simples jogo de plataforma e ganhando mais ação. Em relação ao combate ele é bastante simples, será usado flechas e algumas habilidades especiais, que poderão ser melhoras no decorrer da gameplay para ajudar a eliminar diferentes inimigos. Também ele possui uma boa curva de aprendizagem com a jogabilidade, afim de ser mais eficiente em seus combates, treinando os seus reflexos, pois, conforme formos progredimos iremos encontrar cenários, inimigos e desafios cada vez mais difíceis. Os seus gráficos são visualmente bonitos, contendo um design em pixel art agradável. Além disso, você encontrará uma boa música minimalista, que por sua vez consegue interagir com a ambientação e ações que Dandara passa. Sobre essa nova versão, para os jogadores que ainda não tiveram o contato com o game, ele foi lançado em 2018 e em 2020 lançou uma expansão gratuita: a Trials Of Fear. Na qual foram adicionados novos poderes, novas áreas para serem exploradas e uma nova trilha sonora, assim, você terá boas horas de gameplay. Contudo, Dandara: Trials of Fear Edition é um jogo de plataforma 2D do tipo metroidvania, que apresenta inovação, como sua mecânica que não segue os mesmos padrões do gênero, criando um ambiente de ação, e assim ganhando seu destaque. Além de possuir várias referências históricas do Brasil, é um titulo indie muito interessante, acredito que não agradará a todos, mas, para os amantes dos clássicos, como Medroid e Castlevania ou até jogadores que queiram se aventurar em algo novo, trata-se de um excelente game. Análise para a curadoria   |   |

Bonjour à tous,  Je serait ravi de donner mon point de vue du jeux?.  Sachez que même si mon nombre d'heures de jeux, ne laisse pas plus d'explications car c'est insuffisant ou même parce que j'ai pas encore pris un peut plus de temps est je comprends!. Je vous avertis aussi que tout le monde ne peut avoir le même avis que moi?. Rien ne vous oblige à commenté mon avis?! Je respecte vos choix est vos propre mots... Point positif (Mon avis):  1)Il y a beaucoup de Pve (Pve = Player versus Environnement = Joueur contre environnement en français), se qui veut dire qu'on joue beaucoup contre l'IA ou avec l'IA est je préfère jouer en solo ou en coopération que se prendre la tête avec du PvP ( PvP = Player versus Player = qui veut dire Joueur contre joueur), donc c'est un point fort.  2) Il y a pas de contenu payant tout me se faire gratuitement, à moins d'un prix à payer qui sera la patience mais vraiment beaucoup de patience, donc je vais en parler un peut dans mon article si dessous. 3)Les graphique sont vraiment de qualité super même que si vous mettez tout en ultra c'est à dire très élevé vos yeux vont pleuré. Donc graphisme de belle qualité...  Points frustrants (Mon avis): 1), il y a presque rien 1 dire sauf que être seul le mieux c'est de jouer en groupe à certains moments difficile mais ce n'es pas un problème...  Conclusion: Si vous êtes très patient(e), voir de bonne mentalite alors je le conseille.  Mais je le conseille pas à seux qui sont impatients(te), qui sont malpoli n'oubliez pas que la mentalite du jeux dépasse des plus de soixantaine donc si vous avez 18 ans est que vous insulte vous pouvez passer un sale cardeur. Est si vous voulez avoir tout gratuitement alors la patience se paye énormément. Édit : donc zen lol :)

I would say this game is definitely worth the money. It has a very unqiue feel as a game but I will say it is different from Gmod Tower. The engine is also pretty good for the game itself. The team might be small but they are always doing updates when they can and the updates are always big when get out.  The amount of things you can do in the condos are pretty amazing. You can buy items that are highly customizable like can have any kind of pictures in your condo and posters etc. There is also a bunch of items that you can play songs on and such. The minigames are pretty amazing some of they have bugs still but they are working on them. My personal favorite so far is Virus due to the zombies and humans and short rounds. Also minigolf is pretty fun with friends and sometimes randoms. One of the few things that disapoint me about the game is the money from minigames seem low compared to the casino. The casino seems to payout way more then minigames ever will it. But the casino is more grindy and boring just sitting there pressing a few buttons here and there and you finally when a jackpot and your heart is racing from it. I will keep updating this review was posted with the 3.1 update. I would give this game a rate 8.5/10 +Pros / -Cons ------------------- +No microtransactions or subscription fees +Always meet new people that will talk to. +Custom condos and always getting updated. +Casino games that payout good if you get the jackpot. + Fun minigames with friends and randoms - Minigames don't pay that much comapred to casino games - Condos don't give unites or anything really games expect watching videos. - Still in alpha is in missing a lot of content. - High stakes poker doesn't feel like high stakes at all. - There is very few casino games you can play with friends. - Unites have no pupose after you get so much money due to nothing to spent them on. :)

Особенно хорошо заходят и дают больше предстваления об их жизни короткие видео, которые можно добывать, находя довольно незатейливо спрятанных по уровням сов. (about 200hrs on origin) No doubt the best battlefield game ever made. The campaign was a bit lame but not the worst battlefield has had, the graphics still look great in 2020 and the multiplayer is really active.  The amount of weapons in this game is really impressive and all the attachments and customization make them even more immersive. This game has probably the best map designs out of all the battlefield games, and there is a lot of them(with dlc), and most importantly, this game has the best levolution, which really changes how the maps look and play and make the maps really dynamic.  Sure this game has battle packs and pretty pricey dlc(not on steam though), however the game is not pay2win and the dlc are 100% worth it. I really hope this game stays alive for another decade or two

Holz sammeln, aus Blättern Seile herstellen, eine Axt craften… Check. Erst mit Holz- und später mit Eisenspeer auf wilde Tiere losgehen… Check. Einen Grill craften und die erledigten Tiere brutzeln, um nicht zu verhungern… Check. Soweit so bekannt. Aber jetzt stellt euch das Ganze auf einem Floß mitten auf dem Meer vor. Das ist Raft! Raft ist ein waschechtes Survival-Spiel á la Subnautica, Ark oder Rust, mit dem Unterschied, dass ihr alleine oder mit Freunden zusammen auf einem Floß im Meer treibt. Erst angelt ihr nach Treibgut, später taucht ihr und besucht sogar kleine Inseln. Und ständig baut ihr euer Floß weiter aus. Coole Idee!  Dazu brauche ich eigentlich gar nicht mehr viel erzählen. Wie bei fast allen Survival-Titeln dieser Art wählt ihr zu Beginn einen Charakter aus (nur: männlich oder weiblich) und startet auf einem winzigen Floß nur mit einem Greifhaken bewaffnet. Jetzt müsst ihr nach und nach weitere Ressourcen erbeuten, diese kombinieren, neue Crafting-Rezepte lernen und euer Floß immer weiter ausbauen. Gespielt wird dabei natürlich in der Ego-Perspektive.  Euer Floß muss im Laufe des Spiels immer neuen Ansprüchen gerecht werden. So solltet ihr beispielsweise ein Segel bauen, um gezielt auf bestimmte Ziele auf See zusteuern zu können. Auch ein Anker ist eine gute Sache, wenn man nämlich an einer der vielen kleinen Inseln anlegen möchte, um dort weiterzulooten. Auch die Höhe eures Floßes ist wichtig. Bestimmte hochgelegene Plateaus auf den Inseln erreicht ihr nur über entsprechend hohe Etagen eures Floßes. Und wer ist der Feind? Na wer wohl… na klar, ein fieser Hai, der euer Floß die ganze Zeit umkreist, euch liebend gerne verspeisen würde und zwischenzeitlich auch immer mal wieder am Floß selbst knabbert und so Teile davon abreißt. Natürlich kann man auch gegen den Hai kämpfen, aber ich will hier ja noch nicht alles verraten ;-) Die Grafik von Raft ist zwar wahrlich keine Offenbarung, aber die Entwickler von Redbeet Interactive haben trotz der eher zweckmäßig Optik einen stilsicheren und ansehnlichen Comic-Look hinbekommen, den man sich auch über viele Stunden angenehm ansehen kann. Die Hardwareanforderungen des Spiels sind dann dankenswerterweise auch entsprechend etwas niedriger. Gerade während den Sonnenauf- und Sonnenuntergängen kommt durch die sehr hübsche Lichtfärbung Stimmung auf.    Dies ist aktuell mein schwerwiegendster Kritikpunkt an dem Spiel. Raft ist noch im Early Access und aktuell sind auch leider noch gar nicht so viele Inhalte im Spiel. Es funktioniert alles und es macht wirklich Spaß, aber nach ca. 10 Stunden war ich an dem Punkt, dass ich feststellen musste, dass ich alles gesehen habe. Es gibt einige Dinge, die man erst später im Spiel freischalten kann und tatsächlich gibt es sogar einen versteckten Ort auf dem Meer zu finden und zu erforschen, aber dann ist halt leider Schluss.  Ich bin ziemlich sicher, dass hier im Laufe der Zeit noch mehr Content hinzugefügt werden wird und es gibt aktuell auch schon Hinweise im Spiel, die darauf hindeuten, aber wenn man - nach ca. 10 Stunden - an diesem Punkt angekommen ist, dann kann man eigentlich nur noch versuchen, sein Floß zu optimieren, einen anderen Schwierigkeitsgrad auszuprobieren oder abzuwarten, bis endlich neue Inhalte kommen. Raft besitzt insgesamt drei Spielmodi, nämlich ganz klassisch einfach, normal und schwer. Dabei gibt es nach oben hin insbesondere Unterschiede zwischen dem Nahrungs- und Wasserverbrauch eurer Spielfigur und in den Konsequenzen, falls ihr mal im Spiel ins Gras… oder besser gesagt ins Wasser beißen solltet. Ich habe Raft auf normal gespielt und fand es von Anfang bis Ende fair und machbar. Wer nicht wirklich surviveln möchte, für den gibt es genretypisch noch einen Kreativ-Modus, bei dem man einfach nach Lust und Laune bauen kann. Ich habe den Multiplayer bislang noch nicht selbst gespielt, aber mehrere Stunden Let's Plays dazu gesehen. So bin ich übrigens überhaupt erst auf das Spiel aufmerksam geworden^^ Meiner Einschätzung nach entfaltet Raft erst im Multiplayer seine gesamten Qualitäten. Wie uns kürzlich erst Sea of Thieves gezeigt hat, ist es einfach ein schönes Gefühl, zusammen auf hoher See unterwegs zu sein. Und Aufgaben, die man sich an Bord teilen könnte, gibt es reichlich.  Raft bringt bisher insgesamt  30 Errungenschaften mit, die grundsätzlich alle recht einfach und machbar sind. Um wirklich alle freizuschalten ist aber leider exzessives Grinden angesagt. So verlangt eine Errungenschaft insgesamt 5.000 Objekte mit dem Greifhaken aus dem Meer zu ziehen. Zum Vergleich: nach 10 Stunden Spielen war ich gerade mal bei 500! Hier auf 100% zu kommen ist also eine ganze Menge sinnloser "Arbeit". Schade... Wenn ihr trotzdem versuchen wollt, alle Achievements zu sammeln, findet ihr   einen kleinen Guide von mir dazu. Raft ist ein kreativer, funktionierender und ansprechender Vertreter des Genres der Survival-Spiele. Raft hat viele gute Ideen, ohne das Rad wirklich neu zu erfinden, und überzeugt durch eine zweckmäßige aber hübsche Optik, motivierende Spielmechaniken und einen Coop-Modus. Ich hoffe, dass die Entwickler im weiteren Verlauf der Early Access Phase noch mehr Inhalte hinzufügen, da aktuell nach etwa 10 Spielstunden die Luft raus ist. Die auf Steam geforderten 19,99 Euro finde ich für Raft vollkommen angemessen. Von mir gibt es bereits jetzt für alle Survival-Fans eine klare Kaufempfehlung.

Jedna z najbardziej niedocenionych gier poprzedniej generacji po 3 latach w końcu na PC. Mechanicznie to taki prosty miks slashera, shootera i platformówki, który o dziwo przez 10h gry, ani na chwilę mnie nie nużył. Graficznie ciągle daję radę, a po zastosowaniu SweetFX to już w ogóle tych 3 lat nie widać. Fabuła jest w porządku (chociaż jakaś odkrywcza nie jest), postacie zarysowane rewelacyjnie i grało mi się w to naprawdę fajnie. W dodatku wersja PCtowa zawiera dodatkowy DLC, który gameplayowo różni się dość znacznie od podstawki i warto go zaliczyć (o ile go nie pominemy w menu, bo początkowo ciężko go zauważyć). Na minus muszę zaliczyć dziwne 10sekundowe ścinki, które są dość irytujące i jest to raczej wina skopanego portu niż słabej konfiguracji. Gra mogłaby być też trochę mniej liniowa, bo odnosi się wrażenie, że ciągle jesteśmy prowadzeni za rączkę. Ogólnie solidne 8/10 i polecam!

I'm surprised at Creativerse! I thought it was going to be another Minecraft dupe (yes, the terraforming and cubes are very similar) but it is so much more rich and complex. I love that there is so much to discover and collect. The graphics are beautiful (did you see the lighting? It's gorgeous). Another simple asect that I like is that you don't know everything you can possibly make, meaning that you have to make something first to see what comes next. I like that level of mystery. My one complain is that no matter how low I turn the look sensitivity, it doesn't change. Not sure if that is a glitch or not but it drives me craxy. I also noticed that some parts of the environment are just gone. They are like uncoded, emptiness. I think it would be better if the environments were either larger or they ended with something that made sense; a mountain range, a cliff wall, the ocean, etc.
Cheap and fun....just like my ex :D

думаю всех интересует Рейлджеки да? Ну так вот был на мисии а мы с отрядом не смогли выйти из мисии хост вышел и всё, мы вернулись (с очень хорошими наградми). Пока эти корабли сырые, лучше подождите пару годиков будет лучше. Перейдём на активность обновлений игры, ну не редко, ну сойдёт. Каждных 2 недели по пятницам приходит Торговец из Бездны, проносит с собой ценные и полный шлак правда говоря, и так сойдёт. * - Графика 7/10. * - Гемплей 9/10. * - Механика 6/10. * - Оптимизация 5/10. Ну честно говоря вы заходите в игру с самого начала что-бы фармить и всё. Интересные квесты, сюжетные, и вторичные, ну меня конечно впечетлил квест: Жертва.  Сидеть по 3 часа что-бы убить 1 Владеющего Разумом это бл*ть пи*дец! И туды сюды за Умброй гоняться это такое но сцены прекрасы, даже немножко слёзы выпустил, но так игра фрамилка хорошая можно по 3 часа сидеть что-бы убить 1-го моба, или мамбу так-скажем, скажу вам ещё берегите платину а то будете сидеть без модов как я убивал 1-го моба 3 часа и при этом чуть не завалил миссию. Варфреймы тут странные правда как и оружие ничего не понимаешь в начале "Чё это такое чё за оружия такие странные" подобным вопросом я задавался правда говоря. Ночные Норы тут разные и интересные, и награды за прохождение различные ну интересно очень кто то сошёл-бы с ума сидеть 12 ч в фрейме, и далеко другие люди не с могли-бы сидеть залипая так в монитор. Питомцы красиво сделали, и механизированых компаньонов сделали норм но билды делать и полярить это закалебёшься делать, тут рандом оочень интересный сделал рандом кавата и выпала смита кава это как умножитель ресурсов интересная штука не знаю как бан работает но если с модом прокачать 20-25% будет вам умножитель ресурсов. Система крафта как-бы прикольная и одновремнно удобная, ладно всем удачи и фарма ну кто желает в эту игру играть, и запомните платину тратить только на нужный вам мод, фрейм, часть фрейма, часть оружия, нужные реликвии. Реликвии что это такое? Это так скажем на привычном языке сундук, где есть 6 предметов 3-е из них бронза - 15 дукатов. 2 - серебряные - 45 дуктов и 1 золтая награда 100 - дукатов, они все редкие золото это темблее, зачем вам нужны Дукаты будут, что-бы покупать у Торговца из Бездны что вам нужно для покупки, Кредиты это игровая валюта, и Дукаты собственно всё, я высказался за это время мне полегчало удачи всем вам!

É Um jogo que divide muitas opiniões, pois é bem vamos começar. Desde a   desse ano quando eu vi esse jogo sendo anunciado eu fiquei bastante empolgado, querendo ou não era um jogo novo de terror, então eu fiquei bastante interessado, enfim os meses foram se passando e eis que eu conseguir pegar o jogo na pre-venda um dia antes do mesmo ter sido lançado. acontece que quando esse jogo foi lançado varios usuários estavam relatando que o jogo estava cheio de bugs e muito mal otimizado, então os desenvolvedores rapidamente lançaram um patch corrigiu toda a parte parte dos bugs   e dá má otimização do game. enfim joguei e terminei hoje de manhã então vou falar um pouco do que eu achei desse game sem spoilar é claro.  O Jogo se passa no ano de 1997 E conta a historia de um cara chamado Ellis um ex-policial com um passado bastante conturbado que junto ao seu cachorro Bullet partem uma missão de busca a um garoto que desapareceu nas florestas de Black Hills e ao adentramos as florestas devemos investiga e descobrir o que aconteceu com o garoto.  O Jogo tem uma jogabilidade muito boa e funcional, no jogo temos um Inventário aonde possuímos uma lanterna, uma camera com visão noturna aonde podemos assistir as fitas que a gente encontra ao decorrer do game e temos também o que eu achei mais interessante nesse jogo Um celular o que eu realmente achei muito legal foi o fato do jogo realmente simular um celular real daquela época aonde recebemos SMS, podemos fazer ligações alterar o tema etc e claro o que mais me chamou atenção foi o fato de podemos jogar dois joguinhos que tem no celular um da   e um de   aqueles mesmo de celulares antigo! que tinha muitos nos famosos Nokia Tijolão. Agora falando sobre IA do Cachorro eu achei muito legal a interação com ele lembrando muito jogos como HAUNTING GROUND e RULE of ROSE é praticamente a mesma coisa nesse jogo! Usamos o cachorro para fareja objetos, encontra pistas nas redondezas e claro o que não pode faltar devemos dar carinho para o cachorro se caso a gente trate ele mal ele agirá de forma estranha, eu achei bem legal a IA porém não é perfeita tem algumas falhas em alguns pontos, porém não deixa de ser interessante! Agora sobre os inimigos... não sei se eu posso realmente falar sobre eles porém vou tentar evitar ao maximo spoilar, bem sabe o jogo ALAN WAKE? Então é como digamos.. a mesma coisa você usa sua lanterna para ''mata-los'' o primeiro encontro com eles rende alguns sustos hehe.  A Qualidade Gráfica do jogo é bastante bonita para atmosfera em que ele se passa, tem uma pegada bem creepy o game é bastante escuro eu fui obrigado até a aumentar o brilho do jogo em um trecho para enxerga o que tinha a minha volta pois estava tudo um completo breu, e sem a lanterna você não enxerga absolutamente nada o jogo é realmente muito escuro.

The main idea of the game its become the most Renowned Group of Explorers in the International Society of Explorers,  you can have your own goal, to help History and Science, being Famous and Prestigious or just for Power and Money;  to become the best you need to find all the treasures you can, while you spread your name and feats among the world and Society. You are a group of 3 persons, Each character have their Stats and Alignment that will help you in getting all kind of treasures. Sometimes you will fight for the treasure, other treasures you need a certain ability to gain it. You need to plan every mission, every step, every decission and have luck for getting as much as you can and being the most renowned Explorer.   * Its a perfect Strategy game, If you like Strategy games this is a must to your library * Battles are turn based (I love that) * Lot of enemies like farmers, thieves, pirates, wolfs, sheeps, crabs, vampires, mummies even Nuns will be some of the enemies you will encounter * Lot of characters to play and many groups you can do * You need to replay many games to unlock all treasures and Abilities for all characters * You can save your progress, so if you ruin in some point you can Load it * Many maps and locations you can go * 4 Difficults for the game  * Andventure Mode: in this mode you cant save, the idea is test your strategy and luck and see if you can beat the game with the save restriction.  * You need to replay many games to unlock all treasures and Abilities for all characters  (Maybe boring for players that doesnt like to replay the game) * Only in English * A lot of dialogues to read 10/10   If you like stategies games this a must in your library 8/10    If you dont like strategies games

早期アクセス期間中の2019/8/3時点のレビュー。 2019/8/2のアップデートで日本語に対応。 Steamのライブラリでプロパティを開いて言語設定を切り替え可能。 なおレビュー時点ではあまり翻訳の品質は高くない模様。 最大4人Co-opの見下ろしアクションでジャンル的には とかに近そう。 MOBAによくあるミッション中にスキルを振ってビルドしていく形式なのが最大の特徴。 スキルがミッションごとにリセットされる一時的な成長要素なのに対し、恒久的な成長要素として武器や装備品の軽いハクスラ的収集・成長要素あり。 ミッション内容はボスの撃破、ペイロード護衛、オブジェの破壊、拠点防衛などバリエーションあり。 ミッション（コントラクト＝契約）はリアルタイムで選択できるものが切り替わり、マッチブラウザ的な機能はないが待機プレイヤーのいるミッションにはアイコンが表示される模様。 ミッションで獲得したクレジットや素材を使用してショップで武器/装備ガチャを引いたり気に入った武器/装備にMODを追加したりできる。 クラスはざっくり表現すると近接Tank、近接DPS、射撃DPS、ヒーラーの4種類から選択で、ミッション中のスキルの取捨選択でビルドに幅が出る。 コスメ要素もあるようだが現時点ではまだ色違いスキンが一つか二つ選べるのみ。 早期アクセス開始直後ということもありコンテンツ/システム両面で未成熟な部分は多いが、最大の不満点はミッション終了時に毎回チームが解散になってしまうところ。 実際のプレイはまだ7時間程度だが、ミッション中にレベルさえ上がれば初回プレイからでもUltに相当する派手なスキルが使用できるのは気に入った。 強くおすすめできるほど尖った魅力や新規性のある作品ではないが、早期アクセスを開始したばかりの現時点では一定のポテンシャルは感じさせてくれる。 ニュートラルな評価にしたいところだがSteamのレビューの仕様上どちらか選ばなければならないので期待値込みでおすすめ評価にしておく。

Если спросить профессионального шахматиста, как он может играть тысячи партий на одной и той же карте, с одними и теми же фигурами и необновляющимися возможностями и при этом не заскучать, он, наверное, усмехнется, попросит вас подрасти и немного глубже ознакомиться с содержанием и ценностью этой игры. Конечно, содержательно Dota 2 не имеет с шахматами ничего общего. Тем не менее их роднит очень многое: обе спортивные дисциплины предлагают здоровую пищу для ума, требуют от игрока опыта, серьезнейшего тактического анализа и способности на много ходов вперед предсказывать развитие событий. К сожалению, в общественном мнении Dota не только лишена этих достоинств, но и представляется воплощением порока, зла и самого Сатаны. Когда шахматист днями напролет разыгрывает сотни партий и изучает тонны литературы, это называют профессиональной усидчивостью. Когда тем же самым занимается «дотер» — «задротством». Вышедшая в 2003-м году карта-модификация для WarCraft 3 Defense of the Ancients разбила геймерское сообщество на два непримиримых лагеря. Для одних «дота» стала вершиной эволюции игропрома и образом жизни. Другие смотрят на нее как на обитель пошлости и безвкусицы, «Дом-2» игрового мира. Но кто бы что ни говорил, Dota стала одной из главнейших киберспортивных дисциплин, являясь придатком WarCraft 3. Вопрос ее переквалификации в самостоятельную игру был решен совсем недавно. Ignore all these folks saying that this game is dead. It's seen darker days yeah but the game's getting a steady stream of players back again. Not in the ammounts of a AAA game title but enough to fill a server every so often. Pros: Fast paced FPS/RTS hybrid: You'll always have something to do as a footsoldier and a commander no matter what. Easy to adapt: You'll get used to the methods and strats fairly quickly so you'll know what to do within a few hours of playing. No two game is the same: Buildings can be placed in a varible places that'll deter your team's victory/defeat. Non repetitive: You won't be doing the same thing over and over even though your objective states otherwise, opposing players will be adapting to the situations you put them in which means you'll be doing the same. Cons: The better Gizmos are unlocked at higher levels which means you'll be at a disadvantage for the first few hours of gameplay but going supportive classes and rushing primary buildings as a sieger will fix that in no time. The tutorial is broken btw, look up how to spawn items for it. Stacking is common problem in most servers and it will tend to lead to defeat but by jingo it feels good when you kick them back in their place. As for the cheater problem in all my hours of playing I've only seen one and they were gone within minutes. TL:DR Amazing game, commuinity is slowly growing again, a few set backs when you first load in but with a few hours of patience you'll be kicking asses and taking resource points (well you better be PTFO or your commander will be shoving his/her foot up your rear end) I'll be waiting for you in the front lines recruit.

CI Games (ehm. City Interactive) war nicht immer dafür bekannt gute Spiele zu machen. Ein bestes Beispiel für die schlechten Spiele von CI Games ist die Code of Honor reihe. Jedoch merkt man das sich CI Games von Jahr für Jahr verbessert. Die Sniper Ghost Warrior Reihe fand ich schon damals recht interessant, jedoch war sie nicht das Gelbe vom Ei. Der erste Teil war verbuggt wie eh und je und der zweite Teil war zu einfach und linear. Jedoch gehört SGW2 immer noch zu den Spielen, die ich gerne mal anschmeiße und spiele. Warum? Nun, ich habe selbst keine Ahnung... es fesselt mich einfach gerne mal. Mir persönlich hat die Beta sehr gefallen es gab zwei Stoy-Missionen und einen kleinen Open-World teil in denen noch weitere gegnerische Außenposten verteilt sind. Abseits von ein paar kleinen Bugs, wie das mein Auto von jetzt auf gleich verschwindet oder das ich ab und zu eine komplett andere Sniper dabei hatte die ich nie ausgerüstet habe, ist mir nicht viel aufgefallen. Auch die Performance lief auf meinem AMD-System (System seht in meinem Profil) mit 60 FPS in 1080p (1920x1080) auf Hoch. Texturen brauchen zwar beim Start etwas länger zum Laden aber sobald sie fertig geladen haben läuft alles super. Anders als bei den beiden Vorgängern bietet Sniper Ghost Warrior 3 nur noch wenig Hilfe. Sachen wie die Zielhilfe oder das automatische Zeroing fällt komplett weg (so zumindest in der Beta). Man muss nun selbst den Schuss bei Wind und Entfernung berechnen und im richtigen Moment abdrücken, was das ganze um einiges Authentischer rüber bringt als die beiden Vorgänger. Dazu kommt noch das der Schalldämpfer ähnlich wie bei Metal Gear Solid 5: The Phantom Pain nach einiger Zeit aufgebraucht ist und man dank dem System eine gewisse Taktische tiefe hat. Das Fernglas der Vorgänger wurde durch eine Drohne ersetzt, welche (leider) immer noch Gegner automatisch markiert und man diese hinter Wänden noch sehen kann. Bleibt nur zu hoffen, dass man es deaktivieren kann. SGW3 hat in der Beta schon guten Eindruck hinterlassen und hat es geschafft, dass ich mir zum ersten mal ein Spiel von CI Games vorbestellt habe. Wer schon etwas länger auf der Suche nach einem etwas realistischen Sniper-Spiel ist, sollte SGW3 im Auge behalten. -Co-op Modus mit bis zu 4-6 Spieler (Multiplayer wurde schon bestätigt) -Mod-Support oder einen Mission-Editor (wie die Arma-Reihe) -Weniger Sturmgewehre dafür mehr Sniper -Einen Kletterharken wie bei dem ersten Teil (hat damals nichts gebracht würde dafür jetzt aber passen) -Interaktion mit der Open-World (z.b. Bei den Bürger nach groben Infos fragen etc...) So feddisch :) Schönen Tag euch noch :>

has no Achilles’ heel. An embodiment of passion and dedication, every aspect is fleshed out. With adrenaline-pumping combat, satisfying progression and a narrative that uses the rogue-lite formula to tell a dynamic story, it’s simply put one of the best in its genre.  From the renowned  , developers of   and   comes Hades, an action rogue-lite inspired by Greek mythology. After over a year in Early Access, the game has finally been released in a complete form. Following a series of heated disagreements with his father,   himself,   is displeased with his situation. This sparks a series of attempts to break free from the depths of hell. Despite being marketed as a rogue-like, the game is a rogue-lite, as parts of your progression are retained upon death. Instead of opting for a linear narrative, the game uses its genre’s formula to tell one which develops as you advance.  In most games, the narrative and gameplay are separated, the latter being told through cutscenes in between segments of interactivity. More often than not, this disconnect is brushed off by the fact that it’s just a game. That’s not the case here. Every gameplay mechanic is explained through the lore, bridging the two aspects. Since it’s set in Hell, enemies and the player respawning makes sense.  Characters respond to your actions in a natural way. Each time you encounter one, they likely have something to say about your activities, whether that be the enemies you’ve defeated, the people you bond with or the equipment you’ve collected so far. What’s impressive is that they have something new to say each time! I only heard the same lines on a few occasions.  draws inspiration from Greek mythology. Most of the characters and lore is taken directly from the old myths, however,   offers their own spin on it. Thanks to a fun cast of characters, the narrative is both enjoyable and entertaining. Due to the lack of traditional pacing, the story doesn’t hold many surprises, but the progression of various scenarios left me speechless.  The moment-to-moment gameplay plays like a dungeon-crawler, and sees you going through a series of chambers, battling enemies and obtaining upgrades along the way. Completing a room grants you a reward. Above the door to each chamber, you’ll see what item it compensates you with, adding a strategic element to the formula. As for the combat, it’s viewed from an isometric perspective.  Dashing is the main way of avoiding damage, and doing so is always satisfying. You’ve got six weapons to choose from, each with its own set of moves. They all follow a basic premise of having a normal and special attack. You can also equip a  , functioning as a spell used to harm enemies. Since there’s no tutorial, you’ll have to figure out the controls yourself. Luckily, a visit to the pause menu will suffice. Your first weapon is the  , capable of heavy slashes and a devastating smash which blows nearby enemies away. My favorite was  , a bow viable for eliminating foes from afar. While the number of arms might sound strikingly low, all of them bring something new to the table. It’s easy to spend many hours mastering your favorite. Even so, their movesets are still accessible. The enemy variety is decent; there’s just enough to keep it interesting, with the highlight being the occasional boss fight. There’s one at the end of every locale, as well as a few optional in between. I was surprised when the game replaced a boss with a new one that, although similar in design, hindered a feeling of tedium. Each escape attempt begins in the  . Other than being met with a disappointed father, there’s also the possibility of buying permanent upgrades. The main attraction is the  , which allows you to attain buffs by spending  . These increase your odds of survival, such as dealing more damage by backstabbing, or allowing you to defy death once per run. By talking to the  , you can renovate parts of the underworld. All upgrades for the House are purely cosmetic; think wall decor and furniture. However, there’s also the option of tidying up chambers. This includes new rooms, such as healing fountains, or golden pots that will net you coins when destroyed. These are purchased with  , another of the many attainable supplies. I won’t go over all of them, as the selection is dazzling at first.  The last thing to do before heading out is picking a weapon. Unlike in other titles, you don’t acquire new weapons along the way on a run. There’s no relying on RNG to obtain your favorite, allowing you to specialize in a desired playstyle. On your escape, the Gods of Olympus will often interfere to bless you with boons. These are your way of building your character, functioning as abilities. Each God has their own set of them, often with a collective focus.  , for example, is all about dealing critical damage. Meanwhile,   grants you his famous lightning abilities. Whether you want to be a jack of all trades or specialize in certain boons is up to you. Both are viable options, and it’s fun discovering new powers and ways to combine them. And don’t worry - there’s a lot! Each God has an extensive collection, and some of them only unlock after fulfilling specific requirements. It took me 27 hours, or 28 attempts, to complete a run. However, if you wish to experience the full story, you’ll have to finish it multiple times, a feat which took me 55 hours to achieve.  is known for their stylish presentation.   continues this trend with visionary art direction and a diabolical soundtrack which fits the hellish setting. The underworld is at the top of its game here - never before have I seen a dreadful place captured with such beauty! The character designs capture every detail of their striking figures, with the underworld’s residents appearing as fiendish as you’d expect. There is nothing to put a finger on; it’s exceptional.  In terms of sound, there’s a good chunk of tracks to support the chaotic action, as well as the few quiet moments. There’s something satisfying about ancient Greek music combined with heavy rock, a combination I didn’t expect. Now, what if I told you most of the voice acting was done by members of the development team? This fact caught me by surprise, since the acting is of high quality. Due to the witty nature of the story, some character voices are exaggerated, but that’s what makes it enjoyable.   | 1440p

Esse jogo é um marco na história dos games, o melhor depois do San Andreas na minha opinião, se você ta procurando um jogo com uma história excelente, belos gráficos, ótima jogabilidade, uma campanha longa (30 horas no mínimo), um mundo aberto imenso cheio de coisas pra se explorar, uma ótima trilha sonora, personagens cativantes que fazem você se apegar a eles ao longo da história, pode comprar o GTA 5 sem medo...sem contar que depois de terminar a campanha, ainda tem várias missões secundárias a se fazer que dão quase o mesmo tempo da campanha do game, várias atividades ou então você pode simplesmente sair por ai explorando o mapa, eu praticamente não vejo pontos negativos nesse jogo. Edit: Depois de 30 horas no modo online, infelizmente ele deixa muito a desejar, ele te mata pelo tédio...economia do game super quebrada, você se torna praticamente um escravo dentro do game se quiser ter alguma coisa, a Rockstar dificulta tudo pra forçar o player a comprar cash, as missões dos esquemas pra farm são super tediantes, você tem que atravessar o mapa, e depois voltar tudo novamente, e ainda corre o risco de ser roubado no meio do caminho por hackers ou players veterenos que tem motos voadoras que atravessam o mapa em segundos e explodem e roubam sua carga, pra entrar na sessão demora pra caramba, sem contar que pra fazer as missões do jogo você tem que ter amigos que joguem, já que o jogo simplesmente não te deixa fazer nenhuma missão solo, e essas missões com players aleatórios são extremamente estressantes, quase sempre 1 quita ou cai do lobby as vezes tem uns que entram só pra trolar mesmo, ai todo mundo é kickado da missão por causa de 1 player, se você quiser entrar no online pra zoar um pouco até vale a pena, mas se você quiser crescer no game, ter as casas, prédios, carros e etc...tenha em mente que você vai ter que cashar bastante ou se tornar um escravo do game, acho que é por isso que de 10 players que eu encontro, 9 são crianças...a galera mais madura sem dúvidas já deve ter quitado.

---TR--- Günümüz oyunlarındaki grafiksel güzelliği ve gerçekçiliği vs. arıyorsanız bu incelemeyi okumanızda ve oyunu almanızda şahsen gerek duymuyorum, benim sözüm az da olsa retro ve ve "ulan biraz da nostalji yapalım be" diyen kardeşlerim içindir. Oyunla ilk buluşmam 10 yaşlarımda bir mısır gevreği kutusunda oldu. Birkaç ay oynadıktan sonra cd-rom'u kaybettim ve oyundan bir süre mahrum kaldım. Daha sonra yerel bir korsan cd'ci sayesinde oyunu tekrar buldum. Henüz internet yok, adsl ne onu bilen bile yok, oyunu indirip crack bulmayı akıl edicek yaşta bile değilim, oyunu o dükkanın kataloğunda bulduğumdaki heyecanı size şu satırlar arasında anlatmam imkansız. 26 yaşımdayım ancak oyunun logosunu görmek bile hala ilk günkü kadar heyecan veriyor. O zamanın oyunlarına göre aşırı dolu, heyecan verici, yerinde de olsa absürt bir oyundan bahsediyoruz. Neyse bu kadar sohbet yeter, 4 adet sürücümüz ve haritalarımız var, taksimizi kullanıp müşteri alıyoruz. her müşteri renklerine göre daha uzun mesafeye gidiyor(kırmızı en yakın- yeşil en uzak.) ve ona göre para ve ek süre kazanıyoruz.  Topladığımız paraya ve oynadığımız süreye göre bize lisans veriyor. Bu kadar basit bir oyun. Arcade bölümünde ise bazı parkurlar ve atlamlar yapıp rekorlar kırmaya çalışıyoruz. Sonuç olarak oyunla daha önce aşinalığı olmuş ve görünce "hadi bee" dedirten bu oyunu artık steaminizde de oynayabilirsiniz. Herhangi bir uyumsuzluk sorunu yaratmıyor. 11/10 Nostalji. :) --EN-- If you are looking for graphical beauty and realism in today's games, I don't need you to read this review and nor buying it. I am speaking for who likes retro(a little bit) and "" lets make some nostalgia""  brothers. My first date with the game was in a cereal box when I was around 10. After playing for a few months, I lost the cd-rom and was deprived of the game for a while. After than, thanks to a local gameseller, i found the game again. To that time i have no idea about the internet, or downloading and cracking the game, you cannot imagine that time when i saw that game on the store's catalog. I am 26 and yes, seeing this game's logo is still exciting.I am talking about fot that time's one of the most full, exciting and just a little absurd game. Enough chit chat, we have 4 drivers and maps and picking customers and we try to deliver their destination in time. Every customer has different color for distance (red for nearest- green for the furthest) and we gain points and money. At the end of game(time) we learn licences according to the points. Just this simple.  On the arcade episode we try to break records  in parkours and jumping etc. As a result for familiarity for this game and when seeing this game on steam and saying "wow" players, you can play this game on your steam, just like old times... And i haven't see any compatibility problem. 11/10 nostalgia..
