--- --- +Good progress system +Peaceful ambiance +Beautiful scenery --- --- +Buggy +Unpolished +Bad tutorial --- --- Dark forester brings you into your own peaceful forest to build and defend against waves of baddies in a sort of tower defense/rogue-like/rpg mix of engaging gameplay, leaving the player to build, protect and farm their way to greatness. --- --- : Simple, most comparable to ARPG's. Right click to move, 1-5 to use magic, tab to attack. You can edit the inputs if needed. Very basic. : The mechanics are the most interesting part of this game. There is an open forest and the player can build wherever they would like, except on the very border of the map. While progressing, more buildings unlock and there are more units to place but it's limited by your level as well.  In between waves of the PvE element of the game the player can choose to attack other players for resources which is almost a must because the waves of PvE monsters become increasingly difficult.  That's basically it. Build, then defend or attack and keep building. : The game makes itself seem much more difficult than it is by including an overly lengthy tutorial in one huge mouthful rather than splitting it into spots when necessary.  After you get a hang of what's going on, the game is very simple to the point of boring before increasing in difficulty again as waves increase. : Progression is just like your basic RPG game. You gain xp and resources, level up with xp and build with resources. It seems fairly balanced as long as you're attacking other players as well as defending your base. However, if the character dies or the main house is destroyed, progression is brought back a few levels or in some cases all the way back to the level 1, giving the game a very tense, rogue-like feel to it. --- --- : The environment is nice and is set in an autumn forest leaving the player in a lush world of orange and brown that really feels quite peaceful.  : The player and monster models feel quite aged and plain, nothing to really talk about here and about what one expects from an indie game like this, if not just a tiny bit better than one would expect. : There's not much for animations while fighting but I found that the death animation was pretty cool, although they felt out of place, with explosions and lightning effects.  : The user interface is pretty bad. Filled with unnecessary clutter.When you click on your monster it brings up a huge window that's mostly empty, the building ui doesn't disappear during the combat phase leaving a large black bar down the side of the screen. --- --- : Bugs are abundant in this game everywhere. From buildings randomly disappearing, to poor save states leading to game restarts, game crashes, hefty and unstable loading times and many more. The game is barely playable in its current state and only so if you're willing to run the risk of a complete restart on your progress. : The game runs well on max graphics for me, I don't experience any lag or stutter and it runs smooth.  As mentioned under bugs however, the loading times can be long and even a couple of times the game just refused to load for me and resulted in a corrupt save state. --- --- : If the bugs were taken care of and the was less of a risk of a corrupt save, this game would have a great amount of replay value. It seems to stretch on quite far, but starts to feel like a grind fairly quickly, having to keep your resources up from attacking other players, many of whom are at base level with no defense. : I, personally, would not be happy with purchasing this game for 15$ in its current state. I see many people get it on sale or from when it was on early access for less than a dollar and I feel that's a fantastic value for what you're getting.  However, even if the game was in a pristine state, polished and bug free, I don't feel like 15$ is a good value without the addition of much more content. I'd value the game in it's current state at under 5$.   --- --- Overall, the game seems to be very interesting with loads of replay value and is a great concept, however all of that is overlooked by the bugs, horrible tutorial, and a poorly designed user UI.  I understand the dev is still hard at work making improvements so definitely keep an eye out for improvements to the game in the future, if nothing else, I can surely say that this game is worth following and keeping on your indie radar. --- --- 		CPU 			Intel Core i5 @ 3.60GHz 			Coffee Lake 14nm Technology 		RAM 			16.0GB Dual-Channel Unknown @ 1066MHz (15-15-15-36) 		Motherboard 			Micro-Star International Co. First of all, a really nice game on its own, really love the massive jump from the original to this one But there's one thing that bothers me and genuinely makes this game unplayable for me: At some point the levels start getting actively nauseous, meaning your viewing distance gets significantly decreased and after a certain distance the level zooms away from you, letting everything around you appear rooted in the void And when you move the effect moves with you, meaning the level is basically in constant motion This also affects the way you perceive the enemies since you have no real context for distance And I only became actively aware of that effect when I was already severely nauseous (and I rarely get motion sick or anything similar, not even related to moving images but this is something extreme) So, if any developers see this, please add at least an option to disable the "zooming" as I call it

Moreover I've noticed that there are a lot of people having the same problem, but neither my nor theirs msgs hadn't recive any extensive answers. Just other players trying to guess what've gone wrong. Later I had to download the same game on torrent just to check it. And I've found out that it is actually working! Black-and-white visual novel.  The story is divided into chapters. Completing one let you start over from that chapter in the main menu. There are few options:  -Language (Eng - Ru) -Voice (On - Off) -Sounds (On - Off) Text is static on a trembling background, uppercase capital letters that makes it easy to read. Personally, I think it fits with the mood. Low-light makes it playable during the night. The story isn't outstanding. There is a main route quite linear (and few holes in the story imho) that you have to follow to complete the game. Taking one choice over another (always two choices) could put an end and getting you started again. Unfortunatly you can't change the speed of text/transition. The audio side is so and so. All the voices are dubbed by one single person and most of time is listenable, except for direct speeches which I found annoying.  There are different songs for every ending (really nice) and some standard background piano-music. In summary, this is a fairly short and casual visual novel, good for achievements (just try every option).  However isn't something that I would recommend becouse it has nothing to really play with...

Несколько сотен часов я ждал момента, чтобы написать отзыв про Рокет лигу. Мне не хотелось делать поспешные выводы или упускать какую-нибудь деталь, хотя каждый день руки так и тянулись к клавишам, чтобы начать перечислять достоинства этой игры. Но я ждал. Я не был с рокет лигой с самого начала, моё знакомство с ней произошло немногим позже релизной даты. Но я ещё помню двухуровневый Neo Tokyo, шестиугольную Starbase Arc, веселые ивенты от команды разработчиков и безумно увлекательные турниры, начинающей зарождаться про-сцены. Каждый день в Рокет Лиге был незабываемым, потому что это была идеальная онлайн игра. Она имела все, чего не было в других проектах. Потрясающее комьюнити, постоянные апдейты и подарки от разработчиков, доступные красивые длс. Но особенно «Лигу» отличала (и делала идеальной) уникальная механика геймплея, которая позволяла тащить в соло. Абсолютное преимущество Рокет Лиги над другими играми – полная зависимость результата от твоего личного скилла. Даже если в твоей команде оказывалось два новичка, которые еле-еле передвигались по полю, ты мог запотеть и выиграть игру сам. Когда ты понимаешь, что у тебя есть реальные шансы быть лучшим, что всё в твоих руках – не гипотетически, а вполне обосновано фактами, у тебя появляется мотивация. Играть дольше, тренироваться, детально разбирать механики – игра становится тебе интересна. Тебе в кайф тратить часы, отрабатывая эер-дрибл или пинчи. И когда ты забиваешь очередной гол на нулевых секундах при равном счете, ты понимаешь: все было не зря. На этой вере в светлое будущее и безграничные возможности я добрался до второй платины. Это случилось спустя примерно 150 часов в 2017 году. В этом же году всё пошло под откос. Микроплатежи – зло. Рокет Лига демонстрирует это лучше, чем кто бы то ни было. Вместо того, чтобы добавлять новые карты или обновлять режимы, заняться фиксами подборов игр или обеспечить геймеров большим количеством серверов – команда Psyonix начинает выпускать сундуки, в которых постоянно оказывались одни и те же вещи, только незначительно перекрашенные или видоизмененные.  Сундуков становилось всё больше, вещей – всё меньше, и чтобы не терять потока доната, псионикс выпустили рокет пасс, в который попадали более-менее уникальные вещи (видоизменённые копии которых всё равно потом появлялись в ящиках). Куда шли деньги от донатов? Точно не на поддержку серверов. Мой ранг – платина 2 (позже – золото 2/3). Я искренне верил, что если буду больше тренироваться, то доберусь до самого верха. Каждый день я тратил не меньше часа на харкдорные кастомные тренировки, отрабатывая каждый удар практически по пикселю. Я забивал в свободной игре такие голы, что можно было бы сделать эпичнейшую нарезку хайлайтов. Но как только я заходил в онлайн, пинг возвращал меня на место. Играя из Сибири, будьте готовы к цифрам не ниже 100 (это в лучшем случае, средний пинг из Новосибирска – 120). При этом у меня оптоволокно, тесты скорости выдают 400 на отдачу/загрузку, и даже Дота показывает пинг 68 на японских (!) серверах. Но не рокет лига.  Не верьте тем, кто говорит, что даже на высоком пинге можно выигрывать. Играть – можно. Иметь положительный винрейт – нет. Когда ты ударяешь мяч, а из-за пинга игра засчитывает первое касание противнику, телепортируя модельку твоего болида в другой конец поля – это уже не игра. Это русская рулетка: у кого пинг скаканул – тот и проиграл. Какими бы благими намерениями не прикрывались Псиониксы, как бы хорошо они не описывали раннее сотрудничество с эпиками, доверия их словам нет.  Во-первых, потому что когда после массового доната разработчики присасываются к денежной сиське – это может значить только одно: бабло рулит, и кто платит, тот и заказывает музыку. А решения эпиков уже хорошо всем известны и прекрасно характеризуют Суини & Co. Во-вторых, это окончательно хоронит надежды на глобальное развитие игры (первый шаг был после того, как RL ушла из ESL). Спасибо, Rocket League, за чудесные мгновения. Надеюсь, у тебя всё будет хорошо.

Казуальная головоломка, основанная на физическом взаимодействии... Лейтмотив основной массы положительных мнений немногих людей, запустивших эту игру не ради фарма карточек. Перечисляют положительные качества: приятно смотрится, музыка ничего так... Допустим. Но всё это отходит на второй план, когда уже буквально с первых минут обнаруживаешь огромную такую дырку в игровой механике. Дырень размером с игру. Пропадает элемент головоломки, ведь любой уровень можно пройти, используя одну и ту же донельзя простую механику. Уровней мало (8 всего), как платформер - всё ужасно (отзывчивость откровенно плохая), музыка разве что не успела надоесть за полчаса, которые я потратил на прохождение каждого из уровней на 3 звезды. И минимализм в оформлении какой-то... незаконченный что ли, не стильный. Скучный и не интересный. Терпимо в целом. Но и рекомендовать не могу. Ради очередной идеальной игры можно попробовать. Но если не интересуют достижения, ловить здесь нечего.
Лутать трупы зомбаков, чтобы найти их плоть и кишки, и отдать торговцу...простите, что?

In "Don't Sink" you play as a pirate. You travel from islands to islands and complete quests and delivery jobs. During your journey, you recruit new crewmembers and upgrade your ship. In the sea, you will come across other pirates and random events. It lacks story and depth. You go from islands to islands and defeat other pirates. There you recruit new members and buy supplies. Gain & complete simple quests like delivering supplies form A - B or you must defeat other pirates in this or that island. Conquering existing islands and governing them is made very simple. You need a certain amount of crew members to take over. You can build/upgrade your conquered islands which is the same on all the other islands. That’s about it. You do that repeatedly. After some hours you can really feel the grind. The combat is very repetitive. You get attacked by pirates during sailing. In combat, you can either attack, repair or flee by just pressing some buttons (arrow keys) on your keyboard. All encounters are very uninteresting. There is no real player involvement f.e. aiming. The graphics look okay. Though buildings, ships, islands, characters, etc. look all very similar. It felt like I am on the same island/shop and talk to the same people every time. I did quite enjoy it. But there is not much content here. You can finish the game in around 2-3 hours) So I can’t really recommend this game in this state.

I enjoyed playing this game. The mix of hack-n-slash and RTS was fun enough for me to have played Kingdom Under Fire 2 as much as I have, but other serious flaws are what make me ultimately warn against buying this game.    The population here is dead so you can forget the MMO part. You will not find groups in the queue and every once in a while you might see another player running around in the world. This will lock you out of doing any group content and PVP is nonexistent despite there being a WoW-esque global faction system.  There is no active development on this game. There is still an Easter Egg collection event going on in what is at the time of writing this, September. There is a community manager that still replies to postings on the boards, but don't expect any sort of game updates as only maintenance has been done.    Play it if you've already got it in your library from a bundle or something, just don't buy it now. Instead check out the older singleplayer Kingdom Under Fire titles or any of the Mount & Blades.

The game that ruined my childhood. I confess that still listen to Moradon music occasionally :) I played this game from 2003 to 2010. The name at that time was Knight Empire and was in beta. There were just 4 servers. (Ares, Dies, Beramus, Xigenon) Publisher of the game was K2Network and the official site was  . The official client was approx. 300MB. A monster like troll was greeted you on the main menu of the game :) It was a little bit scary. What was a beautiful days. This game was ended for me after the Fire Drake expansion update released. (2006) I think it was the worst main update of the game. Many players was left the game after this update. The game was become to "Pay to Play" and "Much Pay to Win". Many cheaters and a lot of nonsense bugs were appeared in the game after the Fire Drake expansion update. 10/10 for Knight Empire (2003-2006) 6/10 for between 2006-2010 3/10 for after 2010 I recommend Knight Empire. But I definitely do not recommend this new version or the versions after Knight Empire. I will always remember you with good memories.

I really want to like this DLC, I really do, but I just can't bring myself to. I'll admit I was a bit rusty at the beginning--almost everyone would, unless they were grinding the base game all this time for God knows what reason--, so take my complaints with a grain of "just git gud lmao" The main problems stem from the fact id has either forgotten how to design good arenas or the DLC not having been developed by the main team. I can't find a good reason how could they think "Hey, let's drop an archvile, three carcasses, a couple of mancubi and some other ♥♥♥♥ inside a narrow corridor" and come to a conclusion that is a good idea. But I wish that was the main problem. There is also a matter of horrendously long fights, think 10 minutes long or shorter/longer depending on how good you're at focusing down targets that progress the fight. It wouldn't have probably been such a problem had the arenas not been so small. I can't tell you the exact number of times I made a wrong turn inside an arena and stumbled on 5 or so stacked demons who not only bodyblock you, but were also bodyblocking themselves from reaching you. The arenas in the first two levels (barring a couple of exceptions) are just not designed to accomodate large numbers of demons, but designers still say ♥♥♥♥ it and have you deal with them. I can only really commend the last level, it had WELL DESIGNED fights, large enough arenas and mostly felt like a level from the base campaign. The music is bland, which was to be expected after Gordon's departure. Once again, I really want to say I liked it, but the tracks were so forgetable, I can barely remember a single one and the one I do remember is ambient. Oh, did I say each level has only 1 combat track and it just plays on loop the entire time? Good stuff. I'm not sure how much time did Levy and Hulshult have, so it could be a time issue, but I still feel like had Gordon still been around, he would've written more than than, not even mentioning the quality of his work. The story, ignoring the fact they continue butchering 2016's lore, is reaching cringe levels that should not be possible. Whoever thought that adding a geeky nerd as a medium between the doomguy's inner thoughts and the player is clearly insane. When you had Hayden/VEGA tell you to do stuff, it made much more sense than when some INTERN says stuff out loud that is obvious even without him saying it. The best example was when Hayden transfers himself into Seraph--you clearly understand that Hayden is Seraph--and the first thing you hear in the next cutscene is "HEY DID YOU KNOW HAYDEN IS A SERAPH, HE'S BEEN WITH US THE ENTIRE TIME". No ♥♥♥♥, dude. My expectations for part 2 are even lower than they were for part 1. I can only hope they'll do something about the combat loop. They nailed it perfectly in the base game and here combat just didn't feel fun until I reached the last level.

It's like sitting in a theater in the very front seat... watching this movie. Cutting to the chase, the controls for this game are flawed. They are very sensitive and makes it troubling to be precise during gameplay. Options and optimization are pretty bare-bone, and as a result, you're stuck with very dated and unpleasant graphics and textures. While I give props for Disney Planes: The Video Game being basic (which is good for a game being targetted for a young audience in mind), the game is mostly just going from mission to mission and completing a few tasks. Aside from trying to get a higher score per level, the levels and missions are not interesting enough to go back to previous levels and play again. Overall, this game has a specific audience in mind. Although I think it is a good kids game for its simplicity, there are flaws that makes this game boring and bland, aesthetically and in design.

Хуже чем первая часть. Зaдротская игра в плохом смысле этого слова. Многие места более сложные и издевательские, чем Flappy Bird. И не надо думать, что у меня низкие умения, две версии первой части я прошёл, в одной из них получив 100% достижений.

Hallo, das Spiel an sich ist sehr schön und gut gestaltet. Die Götterfähigkeiten und die Spezialfähigkeiten (bei jeder Waffe RMT) sind interresant ausgewählt  und fügen sich gut ins spiel ein. Der Cooperative Spielmodus ist witzig und zerstört hin und wieder auch mal Freundschaften (lootdiebe). Gegnertechnisch ist es sehr anspruchsvoll gehalten und man muss sich deswegen auch viel bewegen. ABER: Die einzelnen Etagen sind etwas kurz gehalten und man kann diese ruhig noch um ein paar Räume erweitern. Zudem sollten die Räume ansich noch etwas überarbeitet werden, da es in jedem Raum die Möglichkeit gibt, sich an einen Punkt zu stellen an den die monster nicht hin kommen. Es sollte auch mal geschaut werden nach einem paar Bug, z.B. wenn man das match in seiner Gruppe starten will kann es dazu kommen, dass sich das Spiel aufhängt und dadurch das Spiel neustarten muss. Die EP o. XP Vergebung sollte ebenfalls etwas besser gestaltet sein, da ich mit Lv. 2 am Endraum stand und etwas um die 500 gold hatte die ich in nichts investieren konnte. Fazit: Das Spiel ist toll, es ist auch endlich mal eine andere Art von Spiel, jedoch muss man hier und da noch etwas machen. Natürlich ist das Spiel im early access und da ist es klar dass da noch einiges gemacht werden muss, trotzdem würde ich mir das Spiel jetz NOCH nicht kaufen und würde warten bis das Spiel etwas verbessert wurde. (Aktuelle Spielzeit 2h, dann war das spiel durch)

I love Cynide & Happiness a ton, but not enough to support this game. I got it in the Humble Bundle and was pretty excited to see that it was Cynide & Happiness, I played a couple games which only had one other person and took nearly 3 minutes to find a match and I have to say, the charm wore off pretty quickly and I found myself rather bored with under an hour of gameplay.  It's early access currently, so maybe in the future there'll be some updates that make it more enjoyable, but basically it's a mini battle royale game that costs more than it should and has some micro transactions. It's honestly not worth the purchase, I think they should have gone the f2p route.

Шоссе смерти) и Югославию, то по вашему мнению ничего страшного не происходило, а вот когда в США убили ранее судимого негра(который ко всему прочему приставил пистолет к животу беременной женщины), то это ужасная трагедия, на которую надо обратить внимание таким странным способом, как отключение серверов? Вам не кажется, что такая позиция, мягко говоря, лицемерна? И отключайте тогда сервера только в США, почему весь мир должен испытывать неудобства? [English Review] Secret Of Magia has a simple gameplay, nothing much to add. It actually has some mechanics different from other RPG Maker games. However, when put to work, they're abandoned right away. Besides, several imagens from game ___ does not match the actual game. Pros: -??? Cons: - Sprite flaws; - Bland music; - Empty story; - Badly-set items (also having an important item thrown in any place, with no hints or reason); - Broken Battle System (and controls badly set... and you can't reconfigurate them); This game was clearly abandoned by the developer. It would be easy if it was Open-source, because it would be well valorized by several innovating mechanics. Game is not worthy, even having Steam Trading Cards. You would rather spend your time and money with something that pleases you. --------------------------------- [PT-BR Review] Secret Of Magia tem uma gameplay simples, sem muito a acrecentar. Até tem uma ou outra mecãnica diferente dos demais jogos de RPG Maker. Mas todas quando são colocadas em pratica, são abandonadas na mesma hora. Fora que muitas das imagens de propaganda do jogo, não condizem com o jogo real. Prós: -??? Contras: - Falhas com sprites; - Músicas sem graça; - História nula; - Itens mal configurados (fora ter um item importante jogado em um lugar qualquer, sem dica ou motivo); - Sistema de batalha quebrado (fora os controles não estarem corretamente configurados... e não ter como reconfigura-los); Esse jogo foi claramente abandonado pelo desenvolvedor. Seria mais fácil que o mesmo fosse um Open-source, pois daria uma boa valorizada pelas inumeras mecânicas "inovadoras". O jogo não vale, mesmo tendo as Steam Trading Cards. É melhor que gaste seu tempo e dinheiro com algo que lhe agrade.

Açıkçası Spintires oyununu oynamış biri olarak, MudRunner'da içerisinde gerçek anlamda yenilikleri olan bir oyun bekliyordum ancak maalesef hayal kırıklığı yaşadım. Bu oyun benim için ancak Spintires'a bir DLC paketi olabilir, sadece ve sadece çamurlar daha gerçekçi o kadar (tekerleklere yapışıp kalıyor, tekerlek döndükçe etrafa saçılıyor) sırf bunun için almış oldum oyunu, ve bu detayın benim için bir anlamı YOK. Elbette çamurun etrafa saçılışını seyretmeyi sevenlere saygım var buyursun alsınlar, bu detayın dışında yeni bir şey beklemeyin. Ha birde renk paletini bu oyunda aşırı soluk yapmışlar insanın içi kararıyor. Ne güzel almışım aracı sonbahar zamanı ormanda gezicem renk katın biraz demi, nasıl bir vizyon var bu oyunu çıkaranlarda anlamadım. Snowrunner oyununu daha çok göz önüne çıkarmak için bilerek mi yaptılar düşünmedim değil. (Arkadaşımla oynarız diye modlarla uğraşırken maalesef 2 saati geçmişim iade de edemiyorum elimde kaldı...) Bu oyunun övülecek tek bir yanı çamurun detayları, çamura para vermek isteyenler buyursun. Ama aynı zevki bahçede toprağa su döküp elinizle çamuru sıkarken de yaşayabilirsiniz yani bu oyunu almanıza gerek yok, dediğim gibi bu oyun DLC olabilir ancak. Spintires ile kıyaslama konusuna gelirsek, çamur detayı dışında Spintires zaten her anlamda çok iyiydi (hatta çamur detayı zaten güzeldi niye çamuru daha iyi yapmak için bir oyun daha çıkarırlarki), hem daha ucuz hem daha keyif veren bir oyun onu almanızı tavsiye ederim ayrıca eski olduğu için daha çok mod bulabilirsiniz.  Bazı kaynaklarda bu oyunun optimizasyonunun Spintires'e göre daha iyi olduğunu söylüyorlar, Spintires'ta bilgisayarı kasan varsa MudRunner'ı deneyebilir. Игра Rage 2 - невероятный мусор. Сюжет невероятно идиoтский и тупоголовый. Главный герой - дeгeнepaт. Русская озвучка НЕВЕРОЯТНО ТУПАЯ и абсолютно непрофессиональная. Недоактеров малолетних набрали, которые вообще никаких эмоций не передают персонажам. В русских субтитрах ОЧЕНЬ МНОГО грамматических ошибок, что в глаза сразу бросается. Великие грамотеи переводили, которые не умеют даже нормально составлять предложения. В игре кругом навязывающийся, женский, розовый цвет, который глаза режет. Все подсказки, стрелочки, линии, направления - розового цвета. В игре полно персонажей-пидapacoв. Бары ими кишат. Пропаганда пeдepaстии идет полным ходом. В игре нет мужественных персонажей с мужественной внешностью. Мужчин-воинов НЕТ ВООБЩЕ. Только дегенераты-неженки, пидapacы(в прямом смысле слова) и женщины-фeминиcтки-леcбиянки с короткими и крашенными в ядовитые цвета волосами или лысые. В игре есть украденные элементы игр DOOM и Mad Max, но игра такая дрянь, что нельзя и близко ставить её рядом с Mad Max. Только графика пустыни и джунглей красивая. Больше ничего. Не покупать ни в коем случае! 4 дeгeнepaта из 10.

Para avcıları, açık ve net söylüyorum çok ırkçı bir firmadır kendileri. Türk sunucularını Crytek'ten satın aldılar. Oyuna para ödemiş binlerce insana hakaret eder gibi   geçmeleri karşılığında ufak bir hoşgeldin paketi vereceğiz diyerek Türk sunucularını kapattılar. Oyuna bir araba parası vermiş insanlara 50 lira etmeyecek bir paket vererek ilk haksızlıklarını yapmış oldular.  Oyunun Türk sunucularını kapatıp insanları   yönlendiriyorsun, fakat oyun içi satışı euro veya dolar üzerinden fiyatlandırıyorsun. Bütün bunlar yetmezmiş gibi oyunu paraya odaklı hale getiriyorsun ve satın alım yapmayan insanlar için oyunu ızdıraba dönüştürüyorsun.  Şu saatten sonra bu oyunun kalıcılığına güvenip parasını yatırana mı acıyayım, yoksa oyunu gece gündüz oynayıp emek veren insanlara mı? Crytek öyle bir kahpelik yaptı ki; Crytek çatısı altındaki hiç bir online oyuna güvenim kalmadı. Türk oyuncularını sikip bir kenara attılar net olarak. Crytek isimli firmayı "bizim firmamız" diyerek bağrına basan herkesin amınakoyayım yüksek müsaadenizle. İnsanların paralarını çalmaktan farksız bu yaptıkları.

Sama grafika nie wystarcza by gra była dobra. Dostaliśmy "chyba" najładniejszy H&S na rynku. Nic poza tym. Praktycznie na tym kończą się plusy, ale przegrałem swoje, mimo bugów, problemów z grą, to grało się przyjemnie. A dlaczego minus? Tak, żeby zapobiec kupnie gierki, która niby wyszła z wczesnej fazy, ale swoimi problemami pokazuje, że to dalej alpha/beta i daleko jej do pełnej wersji gry. A nie chciałbyś chyba wydać niepotrzebnie kasy? Problemy: -Nie które pasywki w drzewku są bugnięte. Nie działają, lub nie działają tak jak powinny.  -Znikający ekwipunek w skrzynce, czasem idzie go odzyskać po kilku próbach logowania się do gry, ale nie wydaje mi się, że jest to rozwiązanie. -Tak samo znikają odkryte wszelkie barwniki(dyes) i skiny, ich się nie udaje odzyskać. -bugi z bossami, przez które trzeba powtarzać do skutku aż zaskoczy. Finałowy boss ubiłem za 3 razem, przez to, ze 2 razy mi się "wieszał", łapał freeza. -ubogi end game, 4 mapy, które nie są losowe, tylko zmieniają się co szczelinę. Do tego w end game mamy tylko tzw bounty, i szczeliny(mapki), gdzie można dodawać affixy rodem z PoE. Rozbudowa miasta tyczy się tego, że czas potrzebny do ukończenia budowania niwelujemy ukończeniem wyprawy/szczeliny. -Przez nie pewne działające skille jak i talenty w drzewku, praktycznie jesteśmy zmuszeni grać jednym słusznym buildem Gra w obecnej formie zasługuje na 3+, plus na zachętę, ale jak, o ile uporają się z problemami, to końcowa ocena może być 7/10.   Dodam, że ma być chyba 4 akt fabuły, mają dodawać darmowe aktualizacje, dodatki, tylko w tej formie tak działający Wolcen nie ma szans na rynku H&S. Piękne widoczki, samo przyjemne siekanko potworków to za mało.  Dodaj, grę do obserwowanych, obserwuj jak idzie praca nad poprawą gry, czekaj na przecenę, bo gdyby nie te bugi i problemy, to byłby mocnym konkurentem Diablo, do PoE to brakuje mu contentu.  Pozdrawiam PS Trzymam kciuki za Wolcena, oby grę poprawili i nie porzucili jej w takim stanie.

Vacant is a short adventure game based on the same name network graphic novel by Heather Nannelli who is also the developer of this game. Heather Nannelli is   but a newbie in video game developing. 1.   The game takes place either in an alternative universe or in the far future where people live in a same city with representatives of another anthropoid species. The heroine is an intern in the government agency Eye and on her first day she gets put on a case about three missing citizens. The game background could be interesting if Heather brought in more information from her graphic novel. Unfortunately the story itself, which started so promisingly, ended in nothing. Neither the characters themselves nor their motivation are disclosed (especially as regards the strange alien). You know stock characters without real emotions. Due to its length (less than 1 hour) and ludicrous plot Heather Nannelli’s game looks like a demo version not a polished game. 2.   You need only to walk, talk and look at active objects.  You won’t exercise your mind solving puzzles or finding secrets and items because the game is a walking simulator itself. There are serious problems with navigation in the game: the heroine moves at a very slow pace and periodically gets stuck.  3.   When you are talking / viewing items you can choose a reply / action option but your choice does not affect anything. Besides there are some typos and misspelling in the text. 4.   Character’s portraits appearing during conversations are of good quality and painted in interesting style. I decided to buy the game because of this portraits and the Steam tag "adventure game". To my disappointment in the game itself, the 3-D models’ quality is clearly below portraits. The game cannot be played in full screen mode and the developer can’t solve the issue. 5.   Sounds in the game are standard-free and   is not audible in the game. You can hear Holly Standbrook as a narrator in the trailer.  6.   A game lasting less than one hour with stock characters and a boring story is not worth to buy it. ______________________________________________________________ Vacant – это короткая приключенческая игра на основе  одноименного сетевого графического романа за авторством Хитер Наннелли, которая же является и разработчиком данной игры.  Хитер Наннелли –  , но новичок в сфере разработки видео-игр. 1.	  Действие в игре происходит либо в альтернативной вселенной, либо в далеком будущем, где люди живут в одном городе с представителями иных человекообразных видов. Главная героиня - стажер в правительственном агентстве «Око» и в первый же день ее назначили на дело о трех пропавших гражданах.  Мир игры мог бы быть интересным, если бы Хитер привнесла в игру больше информации из своего графического романа.  К сожалению, сама история, которая так многообещающе началась, закончилась ничем. Не раскрыты ни характеры персонажей, ни их мотивация (особенно это касается странного инопланетянина). Вот такие картонные персонажи без настоящих эмоций. Почему никто не проявляет никаких эмоций на грубость, угрозу убийства или появление призраков? Из-за своей продолжительности (менее 1 часа) и нелепого сюжета игра Хитер Наннелли больше напоминает демо-версию, а не законченную игру. 2.	  В игре от вас требуется только ходить, разговаривать и читать/смотреть на активные объекты. Вам не придется напрягать мозг, решая пазлы или отыскивая секреты и предметы, потому что эта игра является симулятором ходьбы. В игре существуют серьезные проблемы с этим самым хождением: главная героиня двигается очень медленно и периодически застревает.  3.	  При разговоре/ рассматривании предметов можно выбрать вариант реплики/ действия, но ваш выбор ни на что не влияет. Кроме того, в текстах есть опечатки и ошибки. 4.	   Портреты персонажей, появляющиеся при разговорах, хорошего качества и написаны в интересном стиле. Именно из-за этих портретов и тега в Стиме «приключенческая игра» я и решил купить игру. К моему разочарованию в самой игре качество 3-Д моделей явно хуже портретов. Игра не идет в полноэкранном режиме, а разработчица игры не может решить эту проблему. 5.	  Звуки в игре стандартно-бесплатные, а   в игре не слышна. В рекламном ролике вы можете услышать Холли Стэндбрук в качестве рассказчика.  6.	  Игра продолжительностью меньше одного часа, с картонными персонажами и скучной историей, не стоит того, чтобы ее покупать.

O jogo está com um visual muito caprichado. Ele é dinâmico do começo ao fim, já que se pode craftar objetos de luta/defesa e mudar sua classe de jogabilidade durante o jogo (classes como escoteiro, médico, atacante e técnico), isto é, você pode experimentar várias estratégias durante a partida. As animações estão muito bem desenvolvidas, além da dublagem que personaliza muito bem cada personagem, tornando-o muito único.     No início, achei o jogo muito divertido. Eu ficava, cada vez mais, engajado em jogá-lo. No entanto, descobri que isso era mais por liberar skins e comprar melhorias, pois, depois de várias horas de jogo, percebo mais defeitos que qualidades que desviam meu interesse de diversão.            Uns dos defeitos principais, que qualquer um vai perceber de início, é a demora para achar partidas muitas vezes, principalmente, de assassino. Eu já demorei mais de 1 hora, sem exagero, para encontrar partida. Como sobrevivente melhorou um pouco, já que há mais jogadores, por enquanto. Outro defeito visível, é que, depois da atualização, o jogo está se desconectando frequentemente e, por isso, quando começa a dar lag, muita gente começa a desconectar-se durante a partida. Além disso, já é frequente, também, começar uma partida com várias pessoas já desconectadas. Alguns bugs podem-se ser notados por iniciantes também, como ficar preso na tela de crafting, não conseguir ativar a mina, pois o jogo não reconhece que você a está usando, ficar preso dentro da sala de resgate (apesar que, às vezes, você consegue atravessar a porta), cair em partida com killer usando switch lag, ou seja, uma hora você está andado e, de repente, você já está morto do nada.      Quando vamos entendendo a mecânica e jogabilidade do jogo, muitas coisas vão perdendo o brilho e a graça, além de perceber outros problemas de designer. Uma coisa que fica desinteressante é o medo de cair em armadilhas. No início, você não sabe onde ficam os pontos onde o assassino pode matá-lo automaticamente, então, ficamos apreensivos. Contudo, como esses pontos são sempre fixos em cada mapa, jogadores experientes não ligam mais para isso, deixando a classe escoteira (scout) inútil (com exceção à sua arma, que, porém, precisa de muitas peças para construir). Outro desinteresse é na arma de lança fogo, que não causa grande danos, é de curta distância e é muito cara para construir.          No jogo Dead by Daylight, quando você leva um hit, seu personagem ganha um boost de velocidade para correr e ter chance de fugir. Em Last Year, é o contrário: você fica preso e paralisado por um tempinho quando leva um golpe. Isso chega a ser muito frustante, já que killers experientes sabem dessa mecânica e tiram proveito disso. Além de tirar proveito de outras coisas que entediam aqueles que jogam: como agarrar um jogador e jogá-lo à uma armadilha. Isso faz com que o assassino não utilize  estratégias com seus poderes mas sim de instâncias simples (não há nada mais fácil, para quem joga de assassino, simplesmente agarrar um sobrevivente e jogá-lo em uma armadilha). Isto desvia, como disse, a estratégia do uso dos poderes de cada assassino. Como se não fosse pouco, todo assassino experiente sabe que no final ele pode ganhar fácil, pois, colocando armadilhas no estreito caminho de saída e ficar campeando em frente, é certeza que todos ou quase todos não vão conseguir escapar. Isso é um problema de designer bem frustrante, tanto para sobrevivente, que já percebe que não há nada mais que fazer, quanto para o assassino, que também se sente desconfortável e chato tendo que fazer isso.      É muito frustrante, igualmente, com o decorrer do jogo, perceber que a mecânica não funciona exatamente como você tinha aprendido. O assassino não pode aparecer e nem desaparecer na frente dos jogadores, mas, com o tempo, você, como assassino ou sobrevivente, percebe que isso é possível sim, é só entender as falhas dessa mecânicas.  Se tivesse partidas filtradas por Rank, muitos problemas frustrantes seriam amenizados, pois os jogadores mais experientes já sabem das falhas, assim como já sabem como passar pelas armadilhas sem ativá-las, porém, demoraria ainda mais para encontrar partidas, já que nem sempre se encontra jogadores facilmente.      Em conclusão, o jogo é novo e tem muito que amadurecer. Qualquer pessoa que ver o jogo ou jogá-lo vai perceber que tem muito potencial e é, sim, pelo menos no começo, divertido de jogar. O problema está na longevidade e estabilização da comunidade, já que muitos, como eu, desistem com o tempo do jogo por perceber que não lhe interessa mais, por fatores supracitados e outros. Neste momento, não recomendo, principalmente quem não consegue jogar com ping alto ou que busquem um jogo sólido para jogar por mais de 100 horas.

O ponto alto desse jogo é sem dúvidas o gráfico, ele é visualmente muito bonito, com paisagens incríveis desenhadas a mão. A jogabilidade é bastante diferente dos jogos atuais. O jogo é em 2D, mas você interage com o ambiente na 3° dimensão que é feito em camadas para o senhor prosseguir com o caminho, essas camadas maior parte do jogo são puzzles fáceis de montar o caminho para o senhor, mas em alguns momentos você terá que resolver alguns um pouco mais trabalhosos, os das ovelhas foram os mais chatinhos.  Mas ainda sim o jogo não te prende muito no enredo e nem na dificuldade, são uns 15 capitulos em que você pode concluir em 2h ou menos. A trilha sonora é muito fraca, não é muito marcante, parece mais um som ambiente de elevador que você maior parte do tempo nem nota que está lá, mudando pouquíssimo de ritmo no decorrer dos episódios. E a história é bastante clichê... basicamente contá-la aqui seria spoiler, uma vez que o jogo é muito pequeno e faz parte da narrativa descobrir o porquê o senhor está em viagem.  Em nenhum instante há diálogos ou mesmo textos para serem lidos. E através de momentos de reflexão, por meio de lembranças, o jogador descobre o que se passou na vida desse senhor. Apesar de meio triste e de retratar um romance, o enredo em si não me foi nada apelativo ou emocionante.  Aconselho a compra somente se tiver em promoção, apesar de não ser tão caro, tem jogos indies curtos que valem muito mais a pena. Não há fator replay na jogatina, pois a história é muito simples e fácil de ser compreendida, não há troféus e nem itens colecionáveis no decorrer do jogo.

Recomendar ou não? Eu queria que tivesse um "depende" aqui... O jogo é um metroidvania no fundo do mar. Os controles lembram bastante o clássico Ecco the Dolphin (que eu curto muito), com direito a música relaxante e vozes bacanas. Tudo é muito poético e bonito, então tudo leva a crer que a experiência vai ser prazerosa. Aí vêm os problemas: o suporte a controle é meio mais ou menos (os prompts na tela continuam indicando comandos de teclado). O mundo é muito amplo, mas você fica meio perdido sem saber para onde ir em muitas ocasiões. Tem umas canções que você pode usar para várias coisas, mas executá-las nos momentos mais tensos resulta em muitos erros. O jogo não é ruim não, é muito bacanudo e tal, mas só vale a pena para quem estiver disposto a encarar um bom jogo com falhas irritantes. Eu já tô velho demais para essas coisas, então quando um jogo me irrita, eu passo logo para outro. Se você tem mais paciência que eu e curte umas aventuras poéticas, talvez curta.

After 4 years of waiting and anticipation. This has been a massive disappointment. There is no defending them with 'this can get better' or 'they are new developers' because in those 4 years I have seen people develop similar games to the level that GiT has if not further. I have played the early testing for this game, I was once one of Frontwire's Community Team - I expected more, my expectations weren't that high, I was not expecting Triple A Quality game. I was however expecting something playable and comparable to the Classic Battlefront series and overall close to the Free Radical vision of Battlefront 3 and as someone who has played that game, this is no where near close or even as good as Free Radical's already flawed Battlefront 3 game. There is no clear art direction, there is no clear game design - Frontwire needs better directing and management staff if they want to fix this game. If they really want to improve - they know how to contact me. Also, Shaymin Gun. (Promised in 2016, Promised in December 2019 - not yet added)

Очередная попытка приобщиться к играм на RPG Maker'е потерпела неудачу, но я все еще надеюсь, что когда-нибудь в моей библиотеке окажется игра, от которой прям дух будет захватывать, так что буду продолжать периодически испытывать судьбу. А пока что попробовал эту, которую в других обзорах постоянно сравнивают с какими-то неведомыми для меня Harvest Moon и Stardew Valley, симуляторами фермера с элементами RPG. Фермерская тематика мне не чужда (играл в Веселую Ферму :) ), но как-то игровой процесс не увлек - ходишь ты такой в трусах по деревне, ищешь рецепты и ингредиенты, что-то там готовишь, что-то там ешь, что-то там покупаешь для дома. В принципе, игра может понравиться тем, кому интересны жанры "песочница" и "симулятор". Тут спокойный саундтрек и довольно симпатичные иллюстрации, но как-то этого не хватило, чтобы погрузиться в игровую атмосферу.

表现一般般的益智游戏。 游戏的主要目的，是通过WASD操纵一块平板的倾斜，来把一团炼金药剂移动到对应颜色的瓶子（出口）里，期间，药剂会被路途中的炼金符号染色，也会分裂，所以有时候需要同时控制几个目标。 操作手感相当之差，就是把一个玻璃珠放进盒子里荡着玩都有趣一些，加上让人昏昏欲睡的通关设定，很难让人不烦躁。 不过闪光徽章和成就中都有比较独特的旋涡图案，个人来说相当喜欢。

Initially was a positive review... Changed this to reflect latest 20MB patch which now only allows 8 clicks per second when using auto clickers Devs somehow think people don't use auto clickers to play games like this? so my almost 700 hrs game time has been wasted, forced to use money because paywalls have been put in place. No where do devs stipulate you cannot use an auto clicker For an EA game this isn't the smartest thing to do, you've just gone and changed the rules when the game was hard enough as it was Game is ruined now... Totally avoid this game, you're going to spend months getting anywhere or you will be forced to spend real money EDIT so I decided after what I consider a completion of the game, to post my thoughts 1st things 1st, devs do respond to things that are broken, so if things have happened to you in game where money is involved or not, they will personally fix this, I like this and praise the devs for this care and attention: this is where the praise ends unfortunately So the game i have now clocked up 900+ hours and I found while it kept me occupied, there was very little to do that was rewarding. I was an active player so used an auto clicker (I advise to use one and it's not cheating as some suggest), the game stalls for some reason and I don't think the migration from Mobile platform to PC has worked well in favor of devs So you can complete this game without money and what I mean complete is 100% achiements, after that there is no real reason for me to continue It's a lot of time and I personally would not do this ever again, but the timing was right and I had spare time based on certain personal goals being achieved, given I pooled my efforts into this (being a fan of the TV show caught my attention so thought any meme could be a good meme). I soon recognised how much effort was required to get my 100% fulfilment, this was a social experiment gone horribly wrong, things changed in the game that made progression feel retarded, held back So I have already posted how auto clicker was nerfed, that wasn't so much an issue as the events were, which became a distraction of the main task, which is for me 100% achievements So these events, while had some nice extras, really all they do is hold you back from doing what youo're supposed to be doing, and it adds up to 125hrs? to the whole dynamic, and yes it's become weekly I don't like how the game has changed so rapidly like things have just been added to please the few paying customers? I don't know and I am not accusing, but asking a question, it just feels that a minority here is being catered for, ie the paying player that can and will get what they pay for, which is obviously an advantage, it doesn't mean non paying players are at a disadvantage, it means that that aspect of the game is being neglected The game is designed to create revenue, cash cows it needs to move to fiscal targets to be succesful Most players (this is an opinion) do not spend money so the driving force of this game, you guessed it is money Devs can do what they want, as long as there is a way of 100% achievements without money, I am all good for that, what doesn't gell well is when devs change the focus of the game mid way, or early on and these changes affect in my eyes the monetary value of the game I will explain, certain things early on which people spent money on changed to where newer players could potentially have to spend more money on or less, given the dynamics have changed Not good Also the fact of the matter that these things should have been worked out in EA, not full release which makes spending money in this game a bit of a gamble, to which my last point's measure This game with money becomes a bit of a gamble as you really do not know what you're getting when you buy the packs, there is not enough consistancy as you cannot sell anything you acquire, other than the cards you get (this is the bonus), but one player might spend more money achieving the same results as another, to me which is too random /TL:DR oh well, such is life... __________________________________________________________________________ I will leave everything here, BUT add that the devs actually do care about their community If I could leave a nuetral review, I would, but alas I cannot There has been some toxic behaviour in threads which devs have stated that using an auto clicker is NOT against ToS The devs are right in posting this and posted due to concerns of the players that use an auto clicker... Kudos to them for being transparent

Boring story, bad execution, lots of bugs even without looking. You find a gamebreaking bug right in the first mission. You are supposed to build a Garden and then it triggers another objective with a timer but you can just not build the garden and the objective changes after like 5 minutes automatically but no timer is started ... How can this not be an obvious thing to think about when making these? This is just the first mission, there are so many other bugs. In one of the last mission you are supposed to prepare and then defend against attacks but the timer ran out and no attackers came in... Or you are supposed to start building a titan gate that is in the middle of the map and being defended but it can be destroyed and no game over is triggered even though it is the main objective. The story itself is boring and poorly executed. The main antagonist is pathetic. His words carry no weight. They dont build up his character. He is weak too. The voice acting is so bad I dont even talk about it. New units are fine, but the entire new race is based around Gardens. They are buildings similar to the vault of plenty, but only for one resource at a time. You can build 10 of them ... It is way too strong. You literally dont have to gather resources after you build them. Most of the god powers are also pretty lame like faster building, faster wood gathering or reviving villagers. Some of them are good like a huge earth dragon or an arrow barrage. Most of the maps dont allow you to go into the 4th age ... there is even one where it does allow you to go to 4th age but doesnt allow you to build a market... like wtf? Why is it there then? On many maps they rely on mass mob spawners. It is impossible to constantly defend against huge fkload of temple monsters. How would the chinese even get hold of the nord giants or greek colossi? It makes no sense and is overpowered on any difficulty. This dlc wasnt even worth 2.5€ I paid for it. It has more bugs than some early access games. It is just not ready for a release yet it is released. Not recommended.

Get Out... is an apt title for this little diddy of a one-man indie horror game. If it's on your wishlist, get it out. If it's in your cart, get it out, if it's in your library, get it out. This game launched at the ridiculous price of $10 USD and has since been halved, and you can generally find it on sale for around 70% off; like I unfortunately did. I like to give small titles with barely any reviews a chance to shine, but boy did this one miss every mark imaginable. Simply put, this game took one aspect of Silent Hills P.T. and nothing else. It's a hallway that loops a total of 50 times, and that's it. On one loop the lights might be going crazy, on another some "creepy" character model might try and dominate you with its T-Pose as it runs at lightning speed towards you. Sometimes you need to pick up a key to progress, other times that same exact key is in a drawer and you can't pick it up; the inconsistencies are frustrating. Sometimes you simply just need to exist in a room long enough to trigger loop progression, but you won't know until you waste that amount of time looking around the hallway for anything you might have missed. The doors open slower than the original door animation in Resident Evil, and what's worse is that you can't see anything at all. Yes, it's another "the darker the scarier" mindset type of release, and worse yet, there's a flashlight with actual battery mechanics. Even worse still... if you decide to quit the game for a bit and go back, and you reload your save data, the game doesn't save the batteries you've collected. You'll be back down to 0, even if you had an abundance of them. Not like it matters much anyway since the flashlight does very little to actually light any area at all, you have to be pressed up against something like a wall or a door for it to illuminate it. Personally, I got stuck on loop 23. After seeing the video of the one brave soul who went before me, turns out I had to wait like 10 minutes for the door to magically pop open. So this game is indeed rigged to just take your money. There's 50 loops of trash stock assets, stock door animations, and one endlessly looping track that starts at the main menu and persists through the entire experience, just to create some sort of longevity to attempt to push buyers past the two hour mark so that a refund can't be given. The developer couldn't even be bothered to fix a spelling mistake in the main menu, or to even make sure the 2 slider options work. There's nothing here, absolutely nothing at all. Get Out... yes, please. The Horror Network   |   Click for Gore

シビアなゲームバランスの2D探索アクション 本作の特徴に2回前後のダメージで死ぬゲームバランスと敵の攻撃をブロックするパリィがあります。 すぐ死ぬゲームバランスはストレスに感じることもありますが、セーブ地点が程よく配置されているのでリトライはそれほど苦になりません。 問題はダメージ2回前後の耐久力と複数所持可能な回復アイテムの組み合わせです。ザコ戦、ボス戦に関係なく、1回ダメージを受けるたびに回復アイテムの使用が必要となるため、非常に慌ただしいです。これだったら最初から４～５回攻撃に耐えられて回復なしのゲームのほうが手間が無い分、好感が持てます。 すぐ死ぬ緊張感を表現したいのであれば魔界村の鎧のようなシステムのほうが良かったのでは？ 敵の攻撃のタイミングにあわせてパリィボタンを押すと敵の攻撃を防ぎ、強力なカウンター攻撃が発動します。しかし、カウンター攻撃はなぜかザコ相手の時のみでボス相手のときは発動しません。ローリングと違って、パリィ後はすぐに反撃に移れるメリットはありますが、あまりにハイリスクローリターンです。そのためボス戦は他の2Dアクションと同様にローリングでかわしつつ反撃するゲーム性に落ち着いているのは残念です。もっとリターンを大きくすれば面白くなったかも。 可愛らしいグラフィックとキビキビ動くキャラクターで個人的には楽しめましたがお勧めはできないかな。

Jetzt habe ich 7 Days to Die eine zweite Chance gegeben. Ich kaufte es vor ca. 1 - 2 Jahren schon und war eigentlich von dem Spielprinzip Minecraft meets Zombie Apocalypse sehr angetan. Ernüchterung folgte auf dem Fuße. Schlechte Performance, üble Grafik, schlechte Animationen und schlechter Sound. Zudem Bugs ohne Ende. Nun, ist Early Access. Kein Thema. Aber mir verpasste das Spiel direkt solch einen Dämpfer, das ich eine Rückerstattung beantragte.  Summer Sale 2018:  Ich stolpere demletzt mal wieder auf die Shopseite von 7 Days und denke, kannst ja mal wieder einen Blick riskieren. Die Bewertungen sind ja nun Größtenteils Positiv, scheint sich ja was getan zu haben. Also kaufe ich gestern das Spiel im Sale zum zweiten Mal. Und was soll ich sagen. Bis auf ein paar neue Sachen hat sich bei Performance,Grafik, Animationen, Sound sowie Bugs fast nichts geändert. Direkt Augenkrebs. Ich bin kein Grafikfetischist, war ich noch nie, ich liebe Retrogames, aber das Teil ist echt übel, zudem verpasst mir das Teil direkt mal ne Motion Sickness. Geht garnicht.  Es gibt tausend mal bessere und schönere Survival Games als dieses hier. Deswegen meiner zweiter und letzter Refund zu 7 Days to Die. Ein drittes mal werde ich es bestimmt nicht holen. So long and thank you for all the fish.

Could be a good game, and is to a degree, but the negative scrolls and poor balancing make this nothing more than a lesson in futility. The game quite often (like every time without fail) removes all your good weapons that took you hours to find without recourse, and hits you with unfair negative stats. Because of this, the only character capable of beating a pyramid is the weakest one, which is Sekhmet the healing class, because of the higher defense and healing ability. No other class can compensate for bad scrolls, and this ruins the fun of the game. Some of the more fun characters that start with better weapons also have ridiculously low defensive stats, and the tank guy has reduced speed and jumping capability, making him completely useless in harder pyramids. Beating a pyramid also resets your character, so you have to beat the next one from scratch.  Because of the horrendously poor game balancing, and constant bad scroll pickups, you will die and restart constantly, and eventually become too frustrated to play the game anymore. I've maxed out most of my upgrades, and cannot get past the 3rd pyramid. Mostly because of the bad scroll drops, which instantly ruin your run. Recommendation: Buy Strafe instead, as Strafe allows you to reset bad upgrades, buy ammo and health, buy useful upgrades, and has better level design. Immortal Redneck has fancier graphics, but that's all it has. The game is nothing but unbalanced and frustrating, and I don't think the IR devs care to fix it, unlike the Strafe devs. Total Biscuit was right to give this game a negative review, because even though the devs addressed some of the problems, the negative scrolls remain in the game, and it ruins the experience.

GODS Remastered (v1.06) + Wiederbelebung eines alten Amiga-Klassikers von den Bitmap Brothers + optimierte Grafik und aktuelle Bildschirmauflösungen + unzählige geheime Belohnungen und Schatzräume + enthält auch die originale Version von GODS zu der man mittels F10 jederzeit wechseln kann und die im Verhältnis gar nicht mal so hässlich ist - sterile und belanglose Grafik (um hier mal den User Sothi zu zitieren) - geänderte Titelmelodie (fehlender Wiedererkennungswert) und auch sonst eher unspektakuläre Soundtracks - Soundeffekte des Helden beim Springen und wenn er Schaden erhält, und auch einige Sounds der Monster waren im Original besser - Figur bewegt sich zu langsam und gemächlich - die vier Bereiche, Stadt, Tempel, Labyrinth und Unterwelt (die jeweils aus drei Bereichen bestehen) bieten zu wenig Abwechslung - kaum Gegnervielfalt - eher abschreckende Spielmechaniken - unspannend - teils frustrierend schwer - kurze Spielzeit Der Jump&Run Klassiker Gods Remastered bietet eine verbesserte Grafik und inhaltlich haargenau das gleiche Spiel wie 1991. Als Herkules versucht man Unsterblichkeit zu erlangen und bedient sich dabei diverser Wurfwaffen die wie in einer Art R-Type abgefeuert werden. Dabei springt und klettert man durch vier Welten und löst dabei diverse Schalterrätsel und schleppt Gegenstände in andere Räume, wobei das Inventar auch noch auch vier Plätze limitiert ist. Beim Händler kann man weitere Waffen, Leben und andere kurze Effekte kaufen. Die unspektakulären Gegner bieten kaum Abwechslung und auch die vier Bosse sind eher unkreativ. Mit der Tastatursteuerung hatte ich zumindest keine Probleme und die F10 Taste beschert ein sofortiges Retro-Gefühl. Generell ist das Spiel zwar wirklich 1:1 das selbe ist, aber es kann mich heute einfach nicht mehr fesseln. Nach fast 7 Stunden war bei mir die Luft völlig raus. Empfehlen würde ich es nur nostalgischen Amiga-Spielern die Gods von damals noch kennen. Aber jüngeren Spielern ist es einfach aufgrund der veralteten Spielmechaniken nicht zu empfehlen. Wenn ihr an weiteren Reviews von mir interessiert seid, dann folgt meiner  .

It's pretty rare for a game to go through Kickstarter, early access, make it to a 1.0 version and even get major updates past that yet somehow still be broken and full of bugs. Starlight Inception was created for both PC and PS Vita and playing it, it becomes very apparent that the Vita was the focus here. Poor options, poor controls and terrible optimization plague all that is Starlight Inception. The package is made complete by the boring dogfights, the way-too-good aim assist and the general lack of AI in your enemies. A shame that a game that received this much attention should remain so terrible.

Welp... This is it. In 2 months AVA is being shut down for good. And with me having 2,100 hours in this game, I think it's finally time I post a review and give my 2 cents worth on this game and it's slow decent from glory. Honestly it pains me to leave a negative review for a game I've spent 3 years of my life playing. It's just so sad to see what it has become.  Granted, I wasn't around back in the glory years when ijji was the publisher, but I've heard the stories and of how Aeria ruined many aspects of this game when they took over. Like making it pay to win and removing a lot of the permanent guns. I don't know all exactly what went down, cause when I started this game it was already high into Aeria's rule and perm guns had come back.  However the pay to win aspects were still very apparent, especially with the Fortune Star weapon series. Where a player would pay $20 for a spin in the Fortune Star weapon real. And get 1 gun for that spin. But this gun would be very OP, some more than others. Like the infamous MP7 Night Flyer. And each Fortune Star series would seem to get more and more over powered. Aeria was also not very good at all about dealing with hackers. This, and with the promotion they brought to the game for the Black Rose knife to TF2 players brought in a lot of toxicity and spoiled this game, prompting countless negative reviews on Steam that were largely unjustified. Most of these were bandwagon reviews at best. Coupled with Aeria's bad execution of the game giving some technical issues for many players to even get the achievements to work. The preconceived notion that this game is merely a CSGO knock off was born which is completely false. For one this game is OLDER than CSGO. This game has one game mode similar to Counter Strike, which is Demolition where one team has a bomb and the other kills or defuses. But that is just one of twelve core game modes. Including Annihilation (team death match), Escort/Breach, Free for All, Domination, Airborn Domination, Escape, Co-op, Infection, Convoy, Riot Control, and more.  Aeria's bad publishing and making the game pay to win was equally fault at causing AVA's downfall as the TF2 community with toxic feedback. But it's pointless to waste my breath on that any further. Later on, Aeria's contract with Red Duck (the game's developer) was terminated and it was announced that En Masse Entertainment would be taking over. We had such high hopes for EME and the future of AVA when this happened. From the start with their closed and then open beta of their version of the game it seemed they were much better. And they improved the anti hack system of the game and for a while, hackers were near non existent.  But it quickly became apparent they were not much better, keeping the pay to win guns. And their solution to the pay to win? Making in game self repair euro guns that were RIDICULOUSLY game breaking OP that anybody could get for in game euros... Flawed thinking. Then the Black Market Glitch happened which was their fault. many players abused this glitch and got billions and trillions of euros in the game over night and it went unfixed for 2 weeks.... 2 whole weeks. EME finally fixed it then perma-banned all the people who abused said glitch... Which was literally half the entire player base. It was all down hill from there. The remaining players decreasing in numbers every day. Only the Elite remained or the cannon fodder newbies with few in between.  Now that Red Duck is in financial crisis, En Masse is shutting down AVA. I can only assume it's because they can no longer milk enough money out of it to make a profit.  This once great game is now barely a shell of it's former self and stuck in the hands of greedy companies that don't give a rat's a$$ about players. Just the $$. I will finish my last 3 achievements and be done.

A game seemed to be riddled with lag infestation and "extra" content. Most if not 80% of the content of the game is from expandable purchases, which are not cheap. To support such a game I would hope that it would; 1. Run smoothly. 2. Look appealing. 3. Be fun and balanced gameplay. 4. Have interesting storylines. 5. Have some longevity with friends and end game goals. However from what I've seen this is mostly not hitting any of these brackets. The game has much internet lag and performance on new content maps and areas is lack luster. Especially for the graphic design style, I'd expect more.  Character models and scenes are washed out, it seems to be going for a darker fantasy Elder Scrolls experience however, the tone may be in the right place but the molded textures and meshes with lacking color and intriguing design work on outfits, scenery, weapons, and even lots of the animations are outdated. I wouldn't have bought the series if I didn't enjoy the storylines and lore of the Elder Scrolls, and this online experience with friends exploring the world is actually a cool idea that Fallout 76 seemed to tank on. This alone tho is not peaking my interest and the game overall is really just a bland experience with not many leading innovations to keep my patience on development time.

Cóż za rozczarowanie! Być może miałem zbyt duże oczekiwania, licząc na to, że wydawca słynnej Syberii zaadaptuje powieść Agathy Christie podobnie jak Frogwares zajął się Sherlockiem Holmesem. Dla fanów detektywistycznych przygodówek możliwość wcielenia się w innego legendarnego detektywa, tym razem Herkulesa Poirot, byłaby miłą odmianą. Byłaby, niestety mam wrażenie, że gra nie została stworzona dla takiego odbiorcy. Bardziej dla małych dziewczynek, co budzi pewien dysonans, bo jakby nie było mamy do czynienia z morderstwami i intrygami, czyli tematyka raczej dorosła, ale sposób jej przedstawienia zbyt płytki, nudny i nieciekawy dla gracza, który ukończył „wymagane”12 lat. Zbyt wiele nie da się napisać o tej grze, ot typowy point'n'click. Można natomiast wytknąć szereg jej wad: 1. Zbyt łatwe łamigłówki. Od gry detektywistycznej oczekuje się pewnej trudności w rozszyfrowywaniu kombinacji do sejfów czy szafek. W A.B.C wszystko mamy wręcz podane na tacy, znajdując szyfr nawet na tym samym obiekcie, na którym mamy go użyć. 2. Powtarzalność działań. Herkules Poirot otrzymuje listy, które musi porównać ze sobą, aby stwierdzić, czy są od tego samego nadawcy. I za każdym razem (chyba 3 razy) robi to w ten sam sposób zwracając uwagę na trzy te same litery. Twórcy gry mogliby się bardziej postarać, tak, aby nasz detektyw za każdym razem w inny sposób musiał porównać listy. 3. Nieudane naśladownictwo gier o SH. Gra w pewien sposób próbuje naśladować nowsze gry o Sherlocku. Rozmawiając ze świadkami czy podejrzanymi, obserwujemy go, skupiając uwagę na szczegółach. Tyle że tutaj jest tych „szczegółów” zwykle 3 i nawet jakoś bardzo nie trzeba ich wypatrywać. Uruchamiamy również nasze szare komórki, aby połączyć podejrzenia i fakty. O ile w Sherlockach mogliśmy zrobić to w różny sposób, tak, że śledztwo mogło albo wskazać na podejrzanego jako sprawcę, albo oczyścić go z zarzutów, tak tutaj wszystko idzie jak po sznurku, według zaplanowanego przez twórców scenariusza. Agatha Christie przewraca się w grobie.

TL;DR Too expensive for the amount of entertainment. Issues like server instability, desync, and the way the zone and PVP works in end game. To the more thorough explanation. The game is based on a great concept for players who want instant action. It's in early access. There's some bugs, which will always be present in Early access/alpha/beta games.   Then there's some issues (I'll cover them at the end).  I strongly prefer doubles as solo and squad tends to get too chaotic for my taste. This is all personal preference. They're implementing new weapons, new vehicles and even a new map. Now to the issues. Before I cover anything, this is what I feel is the problems with the game, and why my playtime has gone from 10+ hours a week til a mere 2-3 whenever I'm tired of other games. Server instability. Desync. You round a wall, and die two meters behind it. You do a popshot, (stand up shoot duck back down instantly) you die/get hit several seconds after you get hit. Fine, I'll accept it, some servers are probably better than others and this might be solved in the future with better servers. The "zone". This is the sole reason I hardly play this game anymore. I haven't listed camping under the issues, because it's a part of every existing FPS game out there, however combined with how the zone quickly forces you to move from place to place you tend to run into someone that's been sitting in a building the entire game, who landed in the centre of the zone. With no intention to leave until he's forced out, and you have to sprint for your life towards him, because the zone is biting your buttocks. The main problem regarding the zone isn't the campers, it's the speed, the time and the idea of how the zone should work. The closer you get to the end game, the faster the zone starts moving again (Shorter time between zones) This leads to less time to actually have PVP combat, so people tend to not engange each other in fear of just dying to the zone. Or it leads to people fighting each other, then all involved players or the winning "squad" dies to the zone just after winning the fight. At the end of the game there should be the "better players" alive, but forcing them to run without having time to engage, removes the tactical skill at a point where it should be what is required to advance. There's very little time to PVP (90 seconds) when players actually start to get close to each other. In these 90 seconds you have to: 1. Fight other players that's cutting of your path to safe haven. (That could be a squad of 4, or 2 double teams on each side) 2. Win that/those fights. 3. Heal back up (takes approx. 10-12 seconds) 4. Run your buttocks to the next zone, which could be a pretty decent run. 5. Pray to God no one is already inside the "safezone" looking towards you. Just recently I had a game where I ninja'd up on some sniper, shot him in the head from 2 meters, took his sniper, killed 4 people lying prone in the field avoiding battle, 5th person starts shooting at me I end up killing him, but the new zone was just so far away that I couldn't even make it in. At that point there was only me + 2 others left. I had no chance to make it in there. The first 4 kills was 1 shot headshots meaning I used as little time as possible, 5th guy I shot at for about 20-30 sec. ( I didn't take a single hit, so no reason to heal.) 90 sec is way to little time for players to clear areas, engage fights, heal, move, and get in a safe position. If this game just added a minute or two to the end zone, so this was possible, it would be such a great game, but running from the zone and dying more to PvE than PvP in an FPS PVP game, is just sad and demoralizing.

Eu iria até começar minha review falando sobre o enredo do game, mas o mesmo não está presente em ambos os jogos da franquia Insurgency. O game inicia em um tutorial que lhe ensina o básico para começar a jogar e depois te larga em alguma partida que se for sua primeira vez jogando, você ficará deveras perdido. Insurgency se trata de um jogo competitivo tático, onde 2 times terão de lutar em diversos mapas e modos de jogo para capturar o objetivo inimigo ou eliminar todos os jogadores do time adversário.  Infelizmente a parte tática do jogo somente funciona na teoria mesmo, pois quando você entra em uma partida pública, só conseguimos ouvir pessoas gritando, xingando ou jogando por si só. Em um jogo que preza o estilo tático, isso pode ser muito frustrante às vezes. Já que uma grande maioria dos jogadores preferem não jogar em equipe, o game pode ser um tanto quando desafiador em alguns momentos, já que a comunicação é essencial em um jogo como este.  O jogo funciona muito bem, com sua jogabilidade bem fluída e em um meio termo entre realismo e arcade muito bem balanceado. Em comparação com o primeiro Insurgency, houveram melhoras muito significativas, mas ainda sim o game não perde sua identidade. Na questão de melhorias que citei logo acima, dentre elas estão: gráficos lindos, uma jogabilidade bem semelhante a seu antecessor, só que mais bem trabalhada, armas com visuais novos, mapas etc.  Entretanto, algo que não houve melhorias significativas foi o modo CO-OP. Este modo funciona de forma igual a seu antecessor, uma equipe de vários jogadores, tendo que capturar/destruir pontos inimigos controlados pela IA. Porém como nem tudo é perfeito, a IA é extremamente burra e basicamente segue um padrão, que esse seria: avançar nos jogadores por todos os lados de maneira abundante e de vez em quando ficar parados em cantos do mapa olhando para a parede.  O modo padrão PvP é exatamente igual ao CO-OP só que ao invés de lutarmos contra bots, lutaremos contra outros players, no estilo mais padrão possível. Antes de começar a partida, podemos escolher entre diversas classes e alguma delas contendo habilidades e armas específicas. O que mais me incomodou neste game, foi a pequena quantia de jogadores, tanto no modo PvP, quando no PvE e competitivo. Infelizmente na maioria das vezes só iremos conseguir jogar em servidores americanos ou europeus, já que nos servidores da América latina, faltam jogadores. Dependendo do servidor, o jogo será quase impossível de ser jogado devido ao lag. Podemos customizar nosso personagem de ambos os times. A customização é bem simples e bem dispensável. Para podermos comprar novos acessórios, precisaremos somente jogar para ganharmos pontos, que servem como dinheiro do game. Algo que preciso muito elogiar é o sistema de sonoro. Já que este se trata de um jogo competitivo, em diversas ocasiões precisaremos ouvir passos ou até barulhos do recarregamento das armas; e isso o game consegue se sair muito bem.  Não irei recomendar o game por 3 principais motivos: sua comunidade um tanto quanto tóxica, pois acho que a maioria das pessoas não querem jogar um game com jogadores tóxicos; falta de jogadores nos servidores da América latina, e seu preço alto para um game deste tipo. Tirando isso, o jogo consegue muito bem desempenhar seu papel como um shooter tático competitivo. Com gráficos muito bonitos, um sistema sonoro ótimo e uma jogabilidade fluída, é uma pena o game não ser tão viável assim para nós brasileiros. Review para curadoria

I think he had a friend back in the old town he misses or maybe his Bro died, because he has a few crayon drawings of him and another kid.            AAAAAAAAAAAAANnnnnyyy Way. You go through and pick the outcomes of who gets what they want at the end of each chapter. +Gutes Kampfsystem -Schlechte Story -Pseudo-Entscheidungen - Dem Spieler wird vorgegaukelt er hätte eine Entscheidung, aber dabei ist die eigene Entscheidung für den Story, für die Welt und für die Charaktere völlig egal. Wenn man eine Geschichte erzhälen will, ohne dass der spieler Einfluss darauf hat, dann sollte man ihm nicht vorgaukeln, er hätte Entscheidungen. Man könnte auch sagen, dass das Spiel hier mit falschen Informationen wirbt... Ich spiele gerne Spiele, in denen man einfach nur Teil einer Welt ist und der Geschichte folgen "muss", bzw sie einfach erlebt. Hab also kein Problem damit, nicht der Weltenentscheider zu sein, und höre/lese sehr gerne auch einfach die Geschichten dahinter. Wie z.b. in MMORPGs. Quests und der Questausgang stehen fest, wenn ich sie erledige. Trotzdem liebe ich gut geschriebene Questdialoge und ~Hintergründe. Doch hier fand ich die Pseudo-Entscheidung dermaßen nervig, dass ich recht schnell das Interesse an der Geschichte verloren habe. Gebt mir keine Entscheidung, wenn sie eh egal ist! Das einzige, was mich dann noch etwas weiterspielen ließ, war das gute Kampfsystem. Wer also ein stumpfes Hack 'n' Slay will, ist hier richtig. Auch wenn es da sicher noch bessere gibt. By the Way: Die 80 Stunden Spielzeit sind ein Fehler/Bug. Ich habe es maximal 10/12 Stunden gespielt, dann hat mich auch das Kampfsystem nicht mehr so stark reizen können.

Years ago, I played TF2 every day, I'd squeak and squawk in the mic in rage and happiness and got banned for being a squeaker, oh were those the days. Suddenly, in June of 2016, the game received an update. The update that ruined TF2 for me. "Meet Your Match" was it's name. It caused the servers to go from "Pick a server and be happy!" to "wait a few minutes to join a server and lose you're ability to join the same one." It was heartbreaking and it filled me with a feeling I'd only experienced when I was banned from that one server. Fury. There wasn't anything I could do to revert the game back to it's old days, so I was stuck waiting. The fan base hated the update and yet Valve being the non-forgiving Half-Life 3 denying fools made us suffer. It was a game gone stale and Valve didn't care. That's why I leave this negative review. Unless you want to stick with matchmaking and waiting for minutes just to join a game, don't play it. Don't support Valve's regime of making people suffer
